loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is 42 years old and lives in the town of Paidah in the Arua Region of Uganda. She is married and has one child who is currently in school. For the past eight years, Amina has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells products like sorghum, dry beans and maize flour. 

To help expand her business, Amina has requested a loan of 2000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more maize, sorghum and dry beans for resale, and will help Amina to generate greater profits and pay for her medical bills and school fees for her child. Amina hopes that in the future she will be able to get another loan from Brac so as to expand her business more. 

Amina is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Amina who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more items like maize, sorghum and dry beans for resale.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 50 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Kasangati Region of Uganda. She is widowed and has five children, three currently in school. For the past four years, Eva has been working hard to manage her small business where she sells molasses. 

To help expand her business, Eva has requested a loan of 2000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more molasses to sell, and will help Eva to generate greater profits and improve her standards of living. Eva hopes that in the future she will be able to build rental houses. 

Eva is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Eva who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to source more molasses to sell.

loans.name: Lourdez

texts.es:
La señora Lourdez esta solicitando un crédito para solventar los gastos escolares que tiene ahora que sus tres hijos entran a estudiar  y para que los puedan aceptar tiene que pagar las inscripciones y comprar los uniformes.
La señora Lourdez es originaria del estado de San Luis Potosí pero radica en esta ciudad desde hace mas de cinco años, llego a esta ciudad en buscando una mejor oportunidades. Actualmente se encuentra separada de su esposo, pero le ayudad con los gastos familiares. Ella trabaja como empleada de un restaurante de comida mexicana, con este ingreso planea pagar el crédito.
Desea que sus tres hijos este bien preparados para que sean un triunfadores y tengan mas oportunidades.
texts.en:
Lourdez is requesting a loan to pay for the school expenses that she has.  She now has three children who are entering school.  In order for them to able to be accepted, she has to pay for their enrollment and buy uniforms.

Lourdez is from the state of San Luis Potosí, but she has been in this city for over five years.  She came to this city looking for better opportunities.  She is currently separated from her husband, but he helps her with the family expenses.  She works in a Mexican food restaurant.  She plans to pay for the loan with this income.

She wants her three children to be well prepared, triumphant, and to have more opportunities.

loans.use: to pay school expenses.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is requesting another 50,000 KES loan to purchase goats for her goat-selling business and pay school fees. She is successful in her business and grateful for her opportunities. 

Fatuma says thanks for her previous loan as she was able to renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase goats and pay school fees

loans.name: Zalika

texts.en:
Zalika is a single mother of three and all her children go to school. Zalika doesn't take care of any additional family members. For the past seven years, she has run a business selling green bananas and she also generates additional income through selling charcoal. Zalika sells retail to all sorts of people and she works seven days a week. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but no running water. Zalika's monthly expenses include rent and school fees and her major business challenges are thieves and seasonality. 

Zalika is requesting a 2,000,000 UGX loan from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches  of green bananas. In the future, she aspires to go directly to the villages of the Masaka district for green bananas and she would also like to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy green bananas

loans.name: Essovale Group

texts.fr: Agriculteur de profession, Mr Koudjounini est né en 1969. Il vit avec sa femme revendeuse et ses 09 enfants en REGION CENTRALE. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Vu qu’il a une grande superficie, 05 personnes l’aident dans l’exercice de son activité. Pour rendre son activité pérenne, il sollicite de WAGES un premier crédit dans notre institution pour acheter des outils de travail. Il voudrait avec le profit supplémentaire faire de l’élevage des volailles. Comme perspectives d’avenir, il souhaiterait acheter un tracteur et permettre à sa famille de mieux s’épanouir. Notons qu’il est le responsable d’un groupement de femmes et d’hommes tous ayant leur foi en la terre. Ils cultivent du riz, du mais.
texts.en:
Koudjounini was born in 1969 and is a farmer by profession. He lives with his wife, who is a retailer, and his nine children in the Centrale region. All of his children have received schooling. Since his farm covers a large area, he has five people that help him carry out his business.

To allow his business to continue, he is seeking his first loan from WAGES in order to buy work tools. With the additional profits, he would like to start raising poultry.

In the future, he would like to buy a tractor and allow his family to thrive. He is also the leader of a group of men and women who all have faith in the land. They grow rice and corn.

loans.use: to buy work tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover family medical expenses

loans.name: Tsuma

texts.en:
Tsuma used his previous Kiva loan to buy merchandise such as wheat flour, maize flour, and cooking fat oil and also stocked his store. He’s now applying for a Kiva loan to expand his range of products and once again stock his display case.

His message to Kiva lenders is the following: “I am very grateful for the opportunity you gave me to invest in my business; it’s something one wants you to be aware of and that you continue supporting us so that we can get far. I know that’s what I will accomplish.”

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, and cooking oil

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty used her previous Kiva loan to expand her business and buy cloth and material for her tailoring business. She’s now applying for another Kiva loan to establish a clothing-selling business and will use her loan to purchase bales of clothing to sell. Her previous loan had a lot of impact on her business and she has been able to provide basic needs for her family.

loans.use: to establish and clothing business

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 45 years old and married with three children who are in school. Since 2009, she has sold new and used clothes and shoes and she is also a farmer to earn additional income. Lucy operates her business in a very busy environment with readily available customers. Through Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to save money because she has been trained in financial management. 

Lucy is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to buy clothes and shoes. In the future, she dreams of opening a boutique business.

loans.use: to buy new and used clothing and shoes

loans.name: Nakatudde

texts.en:
Nakatudde is 32 years old, and she lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Kasangati region of Uganda. She is married and has four children, three of them in school. 

For the past 15 years, Nakatudde has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells bread, sugar, rice, and other household staples. 

To help expand her business, Nakatudde has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more retail items to sell, like sugar, rice, and salt.  It will help Nakatudde generate greater profits and pay for school fees and basic necessities at home. 

Nakatudde hopes that in the future she will be able to start a wholesale shop. 

Nakatudde is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Nakatudde, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but do have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more retail items to sell, like sugar, rice, and salt

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
She used her previous loan to buy bundles of wheat flour, maize, and sugar.  

Today she is requesting a new loan to buy, at wholesale and for cash, bales of wheat flour, maize flour, rice, sugar, and cooking fat oil. This would allow her to have a stock of inventory, get discounts for quick payment, and offer varied products to her customers, who have become accustomed to her quality products every day.

loans.use: To purchase large quantities of wheat flour, maize, sugar, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Dunia

texts.es: Dunia está organizando muy bien la infraestructura de su negocio, por eso con su anterior credikiva compró una maquina industrial plana y mejoró los tiempos productivos. Ahora se dispone a recibir un nuevo credikiva y comprará una máquina recubridora y materiales como telas hilos botones y cierres, con los cuales elaborará prendas de vestir encargadas, a las que con su nueva maquinaria dará un acabado de excelencia. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Estoy muy agradecida por la colaboración que me han prestado en mi negocio espero en un futuro continuar trabajando con ustedes.“
texts.en: Dunia's business is well organized.  With her previous Kiva loan, she was able to buy machinery that improved her output.  Now she is ready for a new loan to buy a specialized sewing machine and materials such as fabric, thread, buttons and zippers.  With these she will prepare garments of high quality, given a finish of excellence with her new machine.  "I am very grateful for the cooperation I have been given with respect to my business and in the future I hope to continue working with you [Kiva partner Fundación Mario Santo Domingo (FMSD)]."

loans.use: to buy a specialized sewing machine and materials like buttons, zippers and threads.

loans.name: Kuña Aty Porvenir Group

texts.es:
El comité "Kuña Aty" tiene 16 integrantes, todas ellas trabajan arduamente para salir adelante tanto como grupo como individualmente.
La sra. Rudy es una persona muy trabajadora que gracias a sus ingresos con la venta de ropas mantiene a su familia.
El crédito va a ser utilizado para comprar ropas como blusas, polleras, vaqueros; y luego venderlas.
texts.en:
The lending group "Kuña Aty" has 16 members, all of whom work arduously to get ahead both as a group and individually. 

Rudy is a very hardworking person, who supports her family thanks to the income she makes selling clothing. This loan will be used for her to buy blouses, shirts, skirts, jeans, and other clothing items so she can later sell them.

loans.use: to buy clothes such as blouses, shirts, skirts, jeans, etc.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: Julio de 26 años de edad hace mas de 4 años trabajó en una empresa ofreciendo servicios de comunicaciones, donde obtuvo mucha experiencia para independizarse y emprender su propio negocio. Fue así como nació su unidad empresarial, donde hace 3 años, ofrece servicios de internet, comunicaciones telefónicas, comercio de celulares y accesorios y servicios de asistencia técnica. Él abre sus puertas al púbico desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, de lunes a domingos, cuenta con clientes fijos y ocasionales y poco a poco su negocio se nota más próspero y él mas entusiasmado en hacerlo crecer. Su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para alcanzar las metas que se propone de ensanche,  pues no tiene la suficiente liquidez para invertir en equipos de tecnología para la venta, accesorios de celulares y para adicionar un servicio de internet  de mayor velocidad, esto es justamente lo que se propone mediante un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual realizará esta inversión pues planea impactar a su clientela y aumentar sus ventas de contado y alcanzar su sueño de prosperidad poco apoco..
texts.en: Julio, 26 years old, worked in a shop offering communications services over 4 years ago, where he gained enough experience to become independent and start his own business. For the past 3 years, he has been offering internet services, telephone communication services, sales of cell phones and cell phone accessories, and technical assistance services. His shop is open to the public from 9am to 9pm, Monday through Sunday, and he has many regular and occasional clients. Little by little his business is becoming more prosperous and every day he is more enthusiastic about making it grow. His working capital is not sufficient to reach the goals that he proposes in his business plan, as he does not have enough liquidity to invest in technology equipment for sale, cell phone accessories, and to add high speed internet services. This is what he would like to achieve with his loan from Kiva, the first loan he will receive from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which he will use to make this investment and thereby increase his sales and reach his dream of prosperity little by little.

loans.use: to invest in technology equipment for sale, cell phone accessories, and to add high speed internet service

loans.name: Daouda

texts.fr:
Notre emprunteur s’appelle Daouda, il loge dans un petit village situé à environ 22 km de la ville principale. Il fait du maraichage depuis 15 ans car il possède des champs et même il en a qui sont non encore exploités. 
Monsieur Daouda n’a jamais bénéficié de crédit à l’IMCEC  et sollicite un montant de 150000 F CFA pour acheter 10 pots de choux, 3 sacs d’engrais, du gasoil, et 20 sacs de fumier.
Au village, les gens vivent en concession, ce qui fait que la dépense quotidienne est partagée par les membres qui habitent la maison.
 Avec l’appui des institutions financière comme l’IMCEC, Daouda aimerait augmenter son exploitation afin d’augmenter ses revenus.
texts.en:
Our borrower's name is Daouda. He lives in a small village located about 22 km from the principal city. He has been a market gardener for fifteen years, since he owns fields and even has some which are not yet farmed.

Mr. Daouda has never had a loan from IMCEC and is requesting an amount of 150,000 francs CFA to purchase 10 pots of cabbage, 3 sacks of fertilizer, some diesel fuel, and 20 sacks of manure. 

In villages, people live 'en concession' which means day-to-day expenses are shared among the members who live in the house. With the support of financial institutions like IMCEC, Mr. Daouda would like to increase his farming to increase his income.

loans.use: to purchase 10 pots of cabbage, fertilizer, and diesel fuel for farming

loans.name: 10 De Agosto Group

texts.es:
El comité "10 de Agosto" tiene 15 integrantes las cuales trabajan bastante y se dedican a criar a sus familias gracias a su esfuerzo diario. Son unidas y emprendedoras.
Eva se dedica a la venta de minutas para lo que necesita productos como aceite, arroz, huevos, carnes, panes, mayonesas, etc. y es con este trabajo con el cual ella saca adelante a su familia.
Solicita el crédito para comprar productos como arroz, huevos, carnes, aceites, etc.
texts.en:
The lending group "10 de Agosto" has 15 members who are all very hardworking and dedicated to raising their families thanks to their daily work. They are very united and entrepreneurial. 

Eva works selling food, for which she needs products such as oil, rice, eggs, meet, bread, and dressings. With this work she will be able to help her family get ahead. She is asking for this loan in order to buy products such as bread, cheese, ground beef, rice, eggs, and oil.

loans.use: to buy bread, cheese, ground beef, rice, eggs, oil, etc.

loans.name: Djiby

texts.fr:
Voulant recharger cette dernière pour préparer les fêtes de Korité, il vient Monsieur Djiby gère une boutique d’alimentation générale depuis 5 ans. solliciter un crédit de 300000 F CFA auprès de l’IMCEC.
Djiby est marié et participe à la dépense quotidienne de la maison. 
Grace au crédit il pourra épargner et améliorer les conditions alimentaires de la famille. 
Il envisage d’augmenter  son fond de roulement avec l’appui des institutions financières comme l’IMCEC.
texts.en:
Mr. Djiby is here wanting to stock up in preparation for the Korité holiday. He has been running a grocery store for five years. He is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs CFA from the microfinance institution IMCEC.  

Mr. Djiby is married and helps in covering the day-to-day household expenses. Thanks to this loan, he will be able to save money and improve his family's food situation. He envisions increasing his working capital with the support of financial institutions like IMCEC.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items (rice, oil, etc.) to sell in his shop

loans.name: Modou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Modou est un commerçant qui s’active depuis plus de 15 ans. Il habite à environ 22 km de la ville principale. Il  achète des légumes pour les revendre sur le marché local. Il a un besoin d’un crédit de 100000F CFA pour acheter 15 sacs de choux. Monsieur Modou est marié et appuie pour la dépense quotidienne de toute la famille. 
Modou démarre sa journée de 10h du matin pour la terminer à 23h du soir.
Il a comme ambition de chercher  un financement suffisant afin de pouvoir exploiter son périmètre cultural.
texts.en:
Mr. Modou is a merchant who has been active for over fifteen years. He lives about 22 km from the principal city. He purchases vegetables to resell at the local market. He has need of a loan of 100,000 francs CFA to purchase 15 sacks of cabbage. 

Mr. Modou is married and covers the day-to-day expenses of his entire family, He starts his day at 10:00 in the morning and finishes at 11:00 at night. His ambition is to find sufficient financing in order to farm his perimeter.

loans.use: to purchase cabbages to resell at the local market

loans.name: Deivin

texts.es:
Deivin  es un joven de 26 años de edad y vive con su familia, en una comunidad de la zona Sur de Costa Rica, ubicada en Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas. La economía local está basada en actividades agropecuarias, donde destaca la siembra de tubérculos, café, maíz, frijoles y ganadería.
Deivin está solicitando un préstamo de seiscientos mil colones exactos (¢600.000), para la compra de almácigo de café (plantas pequeñas) y producir este cultivo ,  necesita además comprar insecticidas, fungicidas, plaguicidas y abono granular para darle mantenimiento a su cosecha y obtener un producto de calidad  .
Deivin es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de la Danta S.A, una de las 150 empresas de crédito comunal de Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Deivin is a young man, 26 years old, who lives with his family in a community in the southern region of Costa Rica, located in Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas. The local economy is based on agricultural activities, mainly the harvesting and raising of potatoes, coffee, corn, beans, and livestock.  

Deivin is asking for this loan of 600 Colones in order to buy small coffee plants to cultivate, as well as insecticide, fungicide, pesticide, and granular fertilizer in order to maintain his crops and obtain a high quality product. 

Deivin is a member of Empresa de Crédito Comunal de la Danta S.A, one of the 150 credit cooperatives in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants and supplies

loans.name: Los Rayos Group

texts.es:
Los rayos es una organización de tres personas que buscan mejorar su calidad de vida. En este grupo la representante es Mónica que tiene 23 años, se destaca por ser una persona sencilla, sociable y muy responsable en sus actividades. Mónica vive con sus padres y su hijo en Ibarra.

Mónica trabaja con sus socios en la crianza de animales, empezó a trabajar en la crianza desde hace dos años, debido a que constantemente su necesidad ha ido creciendo solicita a Fodemi un crédito que lo va a invertir para entrar al negocio de la crianza y venta de pollos, comprando pollos y construyendo un galpon, inversión que le ayudará a incrementar sus ingresos y será beneficioso para su familia.

El sueño de Mónica es poder tener un terreno grande para tener mayor diversidad de animales de granja para criarlos y venderlos y con esas ganancias poder construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
"Los Rayos" is a group of three people who are looking to improve their quality of life. The representative of this group is Mónica, 23 years old, who is a very simple, sociable, and responsible person in her work. Mónica lives with her parents and her son in Ibarra. 

Mónica works with her business partners raising animals. She began to raise animals 2 years ago, and given the constant necessity for new funding is asking Fodemi for a loan she can use to invest in raising and selling chickens. She would like to buy the chickens and construct a chicken coop, an investment which will allow her to improve her income and benefit her family. 

Mónica's dream is to have a large area of land where she can have a greater diversity of farm animals to raise and sell, using the earnings to construct her own house.

loans.use: to buy chickens and construct a chicken coop, in order to enter the business of raising and selling chickens

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru:
Рустам проживает в городе Кургантюбе. Ему 29 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей. Жена Рустама домохозяйка. Он живет вместе с родителями. Рустам работает вместе с матерью на рынке. Он арендует торговую точку, где занимается торговлей тканей и материалов. Торговлей Рустам занимается 7 лет. 
Рустам просит кредит для приобретения новых видов однотонных материалов с целью расширения своей деятельности.
texts.en:
Rustam lives in the town of Qurgan-Tube. He is 29 years old, married, and has three children. Rustam's wife is a homemaker. They live together with his parents. 

Rustam works with his mother in the market. He rents a shop where he sells fabric and materials. Rustam has been a trader for seven years. 

Rustam is requesting a loan for the acquisition of a new type of monochrome material in order to expand his activities.

loans.use: to acquire a new type of monochrome fabric.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 58 years old and married, with five children. 

She sells milk to earn a living. She has been in this business for two years.  She also practices crop farming to generate more income. 

Through Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to keep her own business records because she has been trained in financial management. 

Ruth dreams of expanding her business in the future. She has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy more milk supply.

loans.use: To buy more milk to sell.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 31 years old and married, with five children, all in school. 

He practices farming to earn a living. He operates his business in a fertile environment with available customers. Samuel has engaged in this business since the year 2000.  He is also an employee of a shoe company. 

Peter's hopes and dreams are to become a large plantation farmer and buy a transport vehicle. He has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy seedlings.

loans.use: To buy seedlings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy crates of tomatoes, and strings of chilies and yams

loans.name: El Hadji

texts.fr:
Monsieur El Hadji est un commerçant depuis plus de 15 ans déjà. Il loge dans un petit village situé à environ 22 km de la principale ville. Il vient solliciter pour la 3ème fois un crédit de 100000 F CFA afin de pouvoir alimenter sa boutique en sucre, huile, riz, divers etc.…
El Hadji s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne de son foyer. 
En dehors du commerce, il fait de l’agriculture et ultérieurement, il pense se lancer dans le maraichage et exploiter ses périmètres agricoles.
texts.en:
Mr. El Hadji has been a shopkeeper for over fifteen years already. He lives in a small village located about 22 km from the principal city. He is here to request for a third time a loan of 100,000 francs CFA to supply his shop with sugar, oil, rice, etc. … 

Mr. El Hadji takes care of the day-to-day expenses of his family. Aside from his business, he is a farmer. Beyond that, he is thinking of getting started in market gardening and farming his perimeter.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items (sugar, rice, oil,...) to resell

loans.name: Ana Mirella

texts.es: Ana , de 38 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos y un nieto y vive en San Pedro Sula. ella siempre ha vendido comidas pero hace 3 años comenzó con la venta de ropa de segunda mano con el propósito de obtener más ingresos para su familia, vende ropa clasificada especialmente para damas y niñas, como blusas, pantalones, jeans, vestidos, faldas y  además vende sabanas, zapatos y cortinas cuando le solicitan los clientes. Con el préstamo que está solicitando de 25,000 Lempiras va comprar fardos de ropa para surtir el negocio y con una parte va ampliar el local para vender también golosinas, ella quiere hacer más fuerte el negocio y tener más solvencia económica. Su meta es ampliar el negocio, poner una venta de tacos y ahorrar para darles la educación a su nieto y a su hija.
texts.en:
Ana, 38, is a single mother; she has two children and a grandson.  She lives in San Pedro Sula and always sold food but three years ago started selling second-hand clothes to earn more income for her family.  She sells clothes specifically for women and girls like blouses, pants, jeans, dresses, skirts and she also sells bed sheets, shoes and curtains when customers request them.

She’s asking for a 25,000 Lempira loan to buy bundles of clothes to stock the store and will use part of it to enlarge the shop to also sell snacks.  She wants to strengthen the business and have more economic solvency.  Her goal is to expand the business and start selling tacos and to save up to provide her grandson and daughter with an education.

loans.use: to buy clothes and to enlarge her shop.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es: Orlando de 68 años, inició su negocio de servicios de metalmecánicas, una vez cerraron la empresa donde trabajó, con toda esa experiencia de mas de 20 años y con repuestos para máquinas industriales, bombas de inyección, bujes para maquinas de tipografía, en sus manos, decidió emprender su propia aventura empresarial dando inicio a su propio negocio, en el que hoy ofrece   servicios de mecánica industrial como repuestos, bombas de fusión, bujes, para maquinas etc.  Sus compras las realiza semanalmente y vende diariamente, sus principales clientes son las empresas que se han convertido en sus fijas  compradoras y  le refieren nuevos clientes. Su meta mas adelante es comprar un torno, para dejarle un legado empresarial importante a sus hijos y por eso se esfuerza diariamente, para que su trabajo sea cada vez mejor. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, con el cual comprará materiales, como acero, bronce, aluminio, soldadura, varillas necesarias para ofrecer un servicio oportuno y sin desembolso inicial de recursos por parte de clientes, que muchas veces no cuentan con ello en ese momento. Su credikiva lo beneficiará porque en la actualidad trabaja solicitando un anticipo  del 50% a sus clientes, para comprar los materiales e insumos, con los que  iniciar su tarea, pues su capital de trabajo resulta insuficiente para hacer sus compras; con el credikiva trabajará más holgadamente y atender a los clientes que se presenten y aumentar el número de estos. .
texts.en:
Orlando, 68 years old, started his metal shop when the business where he used to work was closed. With more than 20 years of experience and with the parts for industrial machines, injection pumps, and foundry machines in his hands, he decided to start his own entrepreneurial adventure and began his own business, which today offers many metalworking services. He makes his purchases on a weekly basis and sells daily, and his principal clients are those businesses that have become his fixed buyers and who are continuously recommending new clients. 

His goal for the future is to buy a metalworking lathe, in order to leave a strong empresarial legacy for his children. This is why he works so hard every day, hoping to improve his work all the time. 

He is currently applying for this loan from Kiva which he hopes to use to buy materials such as iron, bronze, aluminum, welding equipment and metal rods. His loan will be helpful because he currently works asking for a down payment from his clients of 50%, in order to buy the materials that he needs to begin his work. Currently his working capital is not sufficient to make all his purchases. With this loan he will be able to work more comfortably and better attend his current clients, while also increasing his client base.

loans.use: to buy materials including iron, bronze, aluminum, welding equipment and metal rods

loans.name: Caacupe Poty 1 Group

texts.es:
El comité "Caacupé Poty 1" tiene 12 integrantes, cada una de ellas trabajan en diferentes actividades para sacar a sus respectivas familias adelante.
María se dedica a su despensa, en la cual vende variados productos para el hogar y la familia, tiene una clientela formada a la cual desea surtir con más productos; con este trabajo ella saca adelante a su familia.
María con este crédito podrá comprar leches, huevos, aceites, bebidas, las cuales podrá ofrecerlas a sus clientes.
texts.en: The “Caacupé Poty 1” committee has 12 members.  Each one of them works in a different activity to support her family.  María has a grocery store where she sells varied products for the home and the family.  She has a regular clientele and she wants to stock more products.  She supports her family by means of this work.  María will use this loan to buy dairy products, eggs, oil and beverages to offer to her customers.

loans.use: to buy baked goods, dairy products, eggs, oil, juice and soft-drinks.

loans.name: Muazam

texts.ru:
Муазам проживает в районе Бохтар. Ей 53 года. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Муазам живет вместе с мужем. Ее муж работает в школе. Сыновья Муазамы находятся в Российской Федерации. 
Муазам восемнадцать лет работает на рынке. Он занимается торговлей овощей и салатов. Муазам берет кредит для покупки томатов и овощей. Она хочет увеличить товарооборот.
texts.en:
Muazam lives in the Bokhtar region. She is 53 years old, married, and has four children. Muazam lives with her husband who works at a school. Muazam's sons are living in the Russian Federation.  

Muazam has been working in the market for 18 years. She sells vegetables and salad. Muazam is taking a loan to buy tomatoes and vegetables. She wants to expand her inventory.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes and vegetables

loans.name: Muhtaram

texts.ru:
Мухтарам жительница района Спитамен. Ей 58 лет. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Мухтарам более 20 лет занимается животноводством. Она разводит крупнорогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кроме того Мухтарам разводит мелко - рогатый скот. 	
Мухтарам просит кредит для закупа телят и бычков с целью увеличения поголовья скота и получения хорошего дохода, также улучшения финансового положения в семье.
texts.en:
Muhtaram is a resident of the Spitamen region. She is 58 years old, married, and has four children. 

For more than 20 years, Muhtaram has been animal husbandry. She raises small-horned cattle for sale in the future. 

Muhtaram is requesting a loan to buy calves and cattle with the goal of increasing her livestock and getting a good income to improve the financial situation of her family.

loans.use: to buy calves and cattle

loans.name: Aiola

texts.en:
Aiola is 45 years old and lives in the town of Pakwach in the Arua region of Uganda. He is married and has six children, four of whom are currently in school. For the past 10 years, Aiola has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar, salt, soap and rice.

To help expand his business, Aiola has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to buy more essential commodities such as sugar, rice, dry beans and maize flour for resale. This will help him to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Aiola hopes that in the future he will be able to start another side business.

Aiola is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Aiola who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities like sugar, rice, dry beans and maize flour for resale.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred, a 37-year-old charcoal dealer in Mshomoroni, Mombasa, is a married mother of five children. She sells charcoal to the residents of Mshomoroni, a business she has had for the past two years. She is doing great.

This will be her second loan from KADET LTD with which she plans to purchase more sacks of charcoal for resale. She will use the proceeds to educate her children and repay her loan. Mildred hopes to have a more profitable business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Bokk Ligguey Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit Bokk Ligguey regroupe 5 femmes qui logent dans la même maison. Elles habitent à environ 22 km de la ville principale. Elles font de l’achat et de la vente de tissu et divers autres produits qu’elles peuvent vendre et qui est susceptible de générer un profit.
L e groupe est dirigé par la dame Fatou qui a une expérience de plus de 5 ans et qui vend du sucre, des tissus, de l’encens. Avec les bénéfices acquis, elle appui à la dépense quotidienne de la famille, afin d’améliorer les conditions alimentaires de cette dernière.
Avec un fond beaucoup plus stable et consistant, elle ambitionne d’ouvrir un magasin de tissus acheté de Doubaï.
texts.en:
The loan group Bokk Ligguey comprises five women who live in the same house. They live about 22 km from the principal city. They buy and sell cloth and a variety of other products that they can sell and that are likely to generate a profit. 

The group is directed by Ms. Fatou, who has over five years of experience. She sells sugar, cloth, and incense. With the profits acquired, she covers day-to-day family expenses to improve the food situation. With a much more stable and substantial capital fund, she has the ambition of opening a store for fabrics purchased from Dubai.

loans.use: to buy and sell cloth and more

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Ruth esta divorciada y tiene un hijo que esta en etapa escolar, viven en casa propia ocupando dos habitaciones, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente obtiene ingresos porque se dedica  a la venta de productos de la canasta familiar, trabajando por más de diez horas al día, lo hace de forma ambulante, es por eso que solicita el crédito ya que recién le operaron de las varices y ahora necesita comprar medicamentos y con lo poco que gana no le alcanza y debe pagar los gastos de educación, alimentación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El sueño de Ruth es tener su propia tienda para ya no salir a caminar ya que es muy sacrificado.
Es la tercera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en: Ruth’s divorced and has a school age son; they live in their two-bedroom house located in the city of La Paz’s Alto San Pedro zone.  She currently earns income by selling basic staple items; she works more than ten hours per day and sells from place to place.  She is asking for a loan because she recently had varicose vein surgery and needs to buy medicine and the little she earns is insufficient because she must pay schooling, food and basic utility costs for her family.  Ruth’s dream is to have a store of her own so that she won’t have to go out walking any longer because that’s very demanding.  This is the third time she’s requested credit from IMPRO and first with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy medicine.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea es soltera y no tiene hijos vive en una habitación en alquiler en la zona norte de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente estudia  secretariado en un instituto por las noches y en el día trabaja como secretaria en una empresa privada ya que debe cubrir los gastos de alquiler, alimentación y educación.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una computadora ya que le será de mucha ayuda en sus estudios y en su trabajo, por que con los ingresos que tiene trabajando por más de ocho horas al día no le alcanza para poder comprarse.
El sueño de Andrea es mejorar sus ingresos y adquirir una casa en anticretico para ahorrar en los pagos de alquileres y también mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Andrea is single and has no children.  She lives in a rented room in the north part of the city of La Paz.  She is currently studying to become a secretary at night and during the day works as a secretary in a private firm since she has to pay rental, educational and food costs.  She needs the loan to buy a computer that will be very useful in her studies and at work because the salary she earns working more than 8 hours daily isn’t sufficient to do so.  

Andrea’s dream is to improve her income and to acquire a house under the ‘anticrético’ modality [transaction whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner could lose the property to you] to save on rental costs and also to improve her quality of life.  This is the first time she’s asked for credit from IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замира  женщина в возрасте  31 года, замужем, имеет троих детей. Муж уже несколько лет работает в Алма-ате, строителем.Он  каждый месяц по возможности присылает ей деньги на расходы семьи. Сама Замира занимается откормом скота,в этом ей помогает ее старший сын,он выводит скот на прогулку по вечерам. У Замиры сейчас несколько десятком голов мелко рогатого скота, коз и баранов. На полученный кредит Замира хочет купить ещё десяток молодых баранов и увеличить поголовье скота.
texts.en:
Zamira is a 31-year-old, married woman with three children. Her husband has been working for several years as a construction worker in Alma-Ate. Every month, he sends her money as possible for the family's expenses. 

Zamira herself is engaged in fattening cattle. She is helped in this work by her eldest son. He takes the cattle for a walk in the evenings. Zamira now has several dozen small cattle, goals, and sheep. 

With the loan received, Zamira wants to buy a dozen young sheep to increase the herd.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru: Гульчехра женщина в возрасте 24 лет, замужняя, имеет одного ребёнка. Муж на заработках в Российской федерации. Сама Гульчехра занимается уходом и откормом дойных коров, которых у неё две. В день они дают 7-8 литров молока, которое она продаёт соседям в кишлаке,от этого у нее небольшой доход. А на крупные расходы ей присылает её муж.Поэтому для расширения своего бизнеса она решила в кредит купить ещё пару дойных коров.Заранее благодарит за поддержку.
texts.en: Gulchehra is a 24 year-old married woman, who has one child.  Her husband is working in the Russian Federation.  Gulchehra is involved in caring for and fattening of dairy cows and owns two of them.  They provide 7-8 liters of milk per day, which she sells to her neighbors in the village and earns a small income.  Her husband sends her money for large expenses.  This is why Gulchehra decided to buy another pair of dairy cows to expand her business.  She is grateful in advance for the support.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cows

loans.name: Sulaiti

texts.en:
Sulaiti is 49 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Kasangati region of Uganda. He is married and has six children, four of whom are currently in school. For the past 10 years, Sulaiti has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells coffee, salt, sugar and other household staples.

To help expand his business, Sulaiti has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to buy more posho and cassava flour to sell. This will help him to generate greater profits and increase his inventory, which will improve his family's standard of living. He hopes in the future to build more rental houses.

Sulaiti is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sulaiti who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more posho and cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Alexander Rafael

texts.es: Alexander  de 38 años de edad, se dedica a la confección de bolsos, actividad que genera sus principales ingresos para lograr sostener su familia y que nació como tradición familiar, pues su padre también se ha dedicado a ella y con él aprendió a trabajar en todas las operaciones desde el diseño, corte confección y acabado de piezas. Así fue como trabajó durante 12 años en diversas empresas, hasta que cansado de operar para otros, decidió empezar a trabajar de manera independiente en el año 2005 cuando organizó su propio taller, invirtiendo su liquidación de la última empresa donde había laborado y de donde recibió además una máquina plana, como valor de su indemnización y él poco a poco agregó una maquina troqueladora pequeña. Con la buena calidad de sus productos, incursionó en el mercado de los almacenes de calzado y bolsos, ubicados en el centro de la ciudad, donde está su mayor clientela. Su mayor sueño es ampliar su negocio y tener un local donde pueda exhibir los productos que elabora. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará cueros sintéticos, correderas, herrajes forros, cartones hilos e insumos en un amplio volumen, para obtener descuentos especiales y trasladarlo a su oferta, haciéndola cada vez mas competitiva y en  esto radica el éxito de su credikiva.
texts.en:
Alexander, 38 years old, works sewing bags. This work generates his principal income which he uses to support his family. This has become a family tradition, as his father also works sewing bags and with him he learned to work in all areas of operations including design, cutting, sewing, and assembling all of the necessary pieces. He worked doing this for 12 years in various enterprises, until he got tired of working for others and decided to start working independently. In 2005 he opened his own shop, investing his money and some machinary from the last place he had worked, and little by little he was able to acquire a small punching machine. With his high quality products, he was able to venture into the market where there are many accessory and bag shops, located in the center of the city, where the majority of his clients are. His biggest dream is to grow his business and have his own location, where he can put the products he makes on display. 

Curently he is applying for this loan from Kiva, his first from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, in order to buy synthetic leather, linings, yarn, and other materials in bulk in order to obtain special discounts. This will allow him to improve his prices, becoming more competitive as a result of his Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy synthetic leather, linings, yarn, and other materials in bulk

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo es un joven  de 25 años de edad,  vive con su familia en una comunidad de la zona Sur de Costa Rica, ubicada en Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas llamada La Danta.  La economía local está basada en actividades agropecuarias, donde destaca la siembra de tubérculos, café, maíz, frijoles y ganadería.
Eduardo  está solicitando un préstamo de un millón cuarenta mil colones (¢1.040.000) para  la compra de semilla de maíz y frijol, insecticidas y fungicidas para el  mantenimiento de  su siembra  de esta manera protege sus cultivos de plagas y hongos que puedan afectar la producción mientras se desarrolla el cultivo,  gracias a este préstamo podrá seguir desarrollando esta actividad y sembrando estos productos pues esta labor es precisamente la que le permite llevar el sustento a su familia. 
El pertenece como muchos otros agricultores de la zona a la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de la Danta S.A, una de las 150 empresas de crédito comunal de Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Eduardo is a young man, 25 years old, who lives with his family in a community called La Danta in the south of Costa Rica, located in Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas. The local economy is based on agricultural activities, mainly the growing and raising of potatoes, coffee, corn, beans and livestock. 

Eduardo is asking for a loan of 1,040,000 Colones in order to buy corn and bean seeds, insecticide, and fungicide in order to protect his crops from pests and fungi that could affect production. Thanks to this loan he will be able to continue planting his crops, which allows him to support his family. 

Like many other farmers in this region, he belongs to the Empresa de Crédito Comunal de la Danta S.A, one of 150 credit cooperatives in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to buy corn and bean seeds and other materials

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
Magdalena es viuda y tiene tres hijos de los cuales dos son independientes, solo vive con una hija en casa de sus suegros ocupando dos habitaciones, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente percibe ingresos de la renta que le dejo su esposo ya que con eso debe solventar los gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos, es por eso que solicita el crédito ya que una de sus hijas debe someterse a una operación y desea ayudarla pero con lo que percibe no le alcanza para poder pagarlo.
El sueño de Magdalena es tener un negocio para mejorar sus ingresos y adquirir una casa en anticretico para tener más comodidad.
Es la tercera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la primera con KIVA.
texts.en:
Magdalena is a widow and has three children two of which are independent; she lives only with a daughter in her in-laws’ house occupying two rooms.  The house is located in the city of La Paz’s Alto San Pedro zone.

She currently earns income from the pension her husband left her and must cover food and basic utility costs with it which is why she’s asking for a loan because one of her daughters needs an operation and she wants to help her but what she earns is insufficient to do so.  

Magdalena’s dream is to have a business to improve her income and to be able to get a house under the ‘anticrético’ modality [transaction whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner could lose the property to you]  in order to have more comfort.  This is the third time she’s worked with IMPRO and first with KIVA.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's surgery.

loans.name: Ñemity Group

texts.es:
El comité "Ñemity" tiene 19 integrantes, cada una de ellas trabaja laboriosamente e invierten el crédito para el sustento de su negocio.
Elvira, se dedica a la venta de dulces como dulces de guayaba, de ciruela, de durazno, etc. con estas ventas ella mantiene a su familia.
Va a utilizar el crédito para comprar frutas como durazno, frutilla, guayaba, etc. y así tener mas variedades de dulces que ofrecer a sus clientes; también diferentes tamaños de presentación de sus productos ya que podrá invertir el préstamo en frascos donde cargar sus dulces para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en: The “Ñemity" committee has 19 members.  Each works hard and invests the loan to stay in business.  Elvira sells sweets made from guavas, plums, peaches, etc. and supports her family this way.  She will use the loan to buy fruit like peaches, strawberries, guavas, etc. to have more variety of sweets available to offer her customers.  She will also have a variety of sizes and presentations available because she will use the loan to buy jars to package her sweets to offer to customers.

loans.use: to buy fruit and jars for her sweets.

loans.name: Naimchon

texts.ru: Наимчон молодой  энергичный мужчина.Он недавно погасил свой кредит и теперь сразу хочет взять очередной кредит.На предыдущий кредит он отремонтировал крышу своего дома которая была в очень плохом состоянии.Теперь же на полученный кредит хочет купить для дома ковер и телевизор.Его старый телевизор уже не подлежит ремонту.Он очень рад что может таким образом осуществить свои планы.Заранее благодарит нашу организацию за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Naimchon is a young and energetic man. He recently paid off his previous loan and now wants to get another. 

With the previous loan, he repaired the roof of his house which was in very poor condition. With the loan now, he wants to buy carpeting and a television. His old television is not repairable. 

He is very happy that he can carry out his plans. Our organization gives thanks in advance for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy carpet and a TV

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a fruit dryer

loans.name: 15 De Agosto Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “15 DE AGOSTO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamata, está compuesta por diez y seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Tomasa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de queso y chuño, venta de salchipapa, tienda de barrio, chofer de volqueta y arado, artesanía de mantas de vicuña, comerciante de ganado, venta de queso y leche, comerciante de carne, venta de comida, venta de bolsas de vicuña, carnicero de llamas, tejido y costura de chompas

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Tomasa es una integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a su casa a visitarla. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de monederos de vicuña y criado de ganado, aprendiendo estas dos actividades de su madre desde su niñez.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ganado vacuno) mismo que comprará de las comunidades aledañas, posteriormente lo utilizara para la crianza. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros.
texts.en:
The lending group "15 de Agosto" is in its first cycle with Pro Mujer. It is composed of 16 members and is directed by a governing board where Tomasa is the president. The businesses that the group members are involved with are very diverse, and they include the sale of cheese and chuño (a freeze-dried potato product), sale of sausages, neighborhood shops, truck and plow drivers, handicrafts, livestock, sale of meat, sale of other food items, sale of bags, and sewing and knitting sweaters. 

This loan will benefit the micro-enterprises of Tomasa's group. She indicates to us that this is the first time that she is working with Pro Mujer, by invitation of a woman from the institution who went to her house to visit her. She currently has a business selling coin purses and raising livestock, learning both of these activities from her mother when she was a child. 

This loan will be used for working capital, to buy livestock from the surrounding communities, so she will be able to raise it. This will allow her to generate income to support her family, as she is married and has 4 children. 

When asked what it is she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the savings component of the lending group structure.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: El Agricultor De La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Felipe, tiene 44 años de edad, es casado, tiene 5 hijos y vive en el municipio de Nueva Frontera Santa Bárbara con su esposa y tres hijos.
El vive en una zona apta para cultivos agrícolas, por eso toda su vida se ha dedicado a realizar esa actividad, pero hace 15 años trabaja en lo  propio, tiene una  finca de café y cultivos de maíz y frijoles. Esta producción la vende en el mercado local. Esta solicitando un préstamo por 7,000 Lempiras para darle un buen mantenimiento a la finca de café y granos básicos, comprara fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra en limpieza de la misma. Su meta es adquirir más terrenos para ampliar la finca de café y aumentar la producción y sus ingresos.
Este préstamo lo solicita en forma de grupo el cual se llama El Agricultor de la Esperanza, que está formado por 8 miembros, que viven en la misma comunidad y se dedican a la agricultura. Según la fotografía se identifican así: de izquierda esta Jose Antonio, Santos, Marvin, Merlins, Felipe, Andres y Jose Elivardo  a la derecha, el Sr. Teodoro no salió en la foto, el préstamo grupal suman 48,000 lempiras y es su primer préstamo.
texts.en:
Felipe, 44, is married and has five children; he lives in the municipality of Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara with his wife and three of his children.

He lives in a zone that’s apt for agriculture which is why he’s spent his entire life in this activity.  But he’s worked for himself for the last 15 years.  He grows coffee and also corn and beans.  He sells his products in the local market.  

He’s asking for a 7,000 Lempira loan to provide good care to his coffee and basic grains.  He will buy fertilizer and pay labor costs to do the weeding.  His goal is to acquire more land to expand the coffee farm and increase production and income.

He’s asking for a group loan and the group is called “El Agricultor de la Esperanza” (Farmer of Hope) which has 8 members who all live in the same community and work in agriculture.  In the photo they are identified thus: From the left it’s José Antonio, Santos, Marvin, Merlins, Felipe, Andrés and José Elivardo on the right.  Teodoro does not appear in the photo.  The group loan total is 48,000 Lempiras and this is their first loan.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
Gerald is 32 years old and married, with three children who are in school. 

To earn a living, he operates a retail shop in a conducive environment with loyal customers. Gerald has been in the business for five years and has employed one person. Besides, he is a teacher. Gerald dreams of operating a wholesale business in the future. 

He has requested a loan of 50,000 KES to buy cereals, sugar, maize flour, and cooking fat for sale.

loans.use: to buy cereals, sugar, maize flour, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Apizakhon

texts.ru:
Апизахон 37 лет, замужем, воспитывает 4 детей.  В 2009 году, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, Апизахон начала свой бизнес в торговле кондитерскими изделиями. Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду  Апизахон, начав с суммы в 40,000 сом , она сумела развить свой бизнес  с ежемесячным доходом  в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS). В бизнесе Апизахон помогает ее муж в свободное от услуг такси время. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Апизахон обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на расширение ассортимента товара за счет закупа печенья и конфет местного производства и из соседнего Казахстана.  Доходы от кредита Апизахон планирует вложить в расширение своей деятельности для того, чтобы оплатить контракт на учебу для старшего сына.
texts.en: Apizakhon is 37 years old, married and raising four children.  In search of a source of income for her family, she started her own business in sales of confectionery goods in 2009.  Thanks to Apizakhon's persistence and hard work, having started with a sum of 40,000 som, she was able to develop her business to have a monthly income of 15,000 som (KGS).  Her husband helps her with the business in his time free from working as a taxi driver.  In order to further develop her business, Apizakhon requested a loan in the amount of 120,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to expand her product selection by purchasing cookies and candy, both locally-made and from the neighboring Kazakhstan.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into expanding her business in order to pay for her oldest son's education contract.

loans.use: to expand product selection

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LOS DIAMANTES,la socia continua dedicandose al negocio de tienda de abarrotes ,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio ,la socia trabaja de lunes a sabado desde las 05:00am hasta las 10:00pm aproximadamente,la socia es una persona emprendedora y responsable con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando por su familia,siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de mercaderia como gaseosas y leche.
La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: She belongs to the “Los Diamantes” (The Diamonds) communal bank and continues with her grocery store.   She’s been in this business for some time and does well thanks to the effort she puts into it.  She works Monday through Saturday from 5am until 10pm approximately.  She’s an enterprising, responsible person who very much wants to continue to work for her family since this is the way she supports them.  She’s asking for a loan to buy merchandise like soft-drinks and milk.  She is grateful for the loan granted and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like soft-drinks and milk.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La socia petenece al banco comunal LOS DIAMANTES,la socia continua dedicandose al negocio de artesania ,la socia elabora muñecas artesanales,carteras entre otros,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio ,la socia a la vez compra y vende otro tipo de artesania como polos,chompas,trabajos hechos en ceramica entre otros,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de materiales como telas e hilos de diferetes colores para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: She belongs to the “Los Diamantes” (The Diamonds) communal bank and continues working making crafts; she makes artisanal dolls and purses, among others.  She’s been in this business for some time now and does well thanks to the effort she puts into it.  She also buys other types of crafts like shirts, sweaters, ceramic items and others to sell.  She is a responsible, dedicated person who supports her family this way.  She’s asking for the loan to buy supplies like fabric and thread of different colors for her business.  She is grateful for the granted loan and commits to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy supplies like fabric and thread of various colors.

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en: Mwanatumu is applying for her seventh loan from Kiva partner Yehu Microfinance. She will use the new loan to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil for her food stall.  These items are highly requested by her customers during this season when her sales usually increase. The previous loans from Yehu Microfinance helped Mwanatumu to increase the number of customers at her food stall. She has the following message: “I am very grateful to Kiva and Yehu Microfinance. I hope to continue prospering with your financial support.”

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil for her food stall.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 40 years old and a food stall owner in Mombasa. She is a married mother of two children. She has been selling food for the past six years.

This marks her first business loan from KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to purchase a variety of foodstuffs, new chairs, tables, and serving dishes. 

She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan and also for the expansion of her business. She hopes to excel in the business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of foodstuffs, new chairs, tables, and serving dishes.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 40 years old and lives in the town of Pakwach in the Arua region of Uganda. She is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past 11 years, Florence has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale, and will help Florence to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Florence hopes that in the future, she will be able to get more money from BRAC to expand her business. 

Florence is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Florence who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Aziz

texts.ru:
Азиз 30-летний мужчина проживающий в городе Вахдат. Он живет с родителями. Азиз имеет высшее образование. По специальности он программист. В этой области Азиз работает более десяти лет. 
Уже шесть лет как Азиз открыл собственный интернет-кафе. Его бизнес приносит хороший доход. Азиз хочет открыт еще один интернет-кафе. Он просит кредит для приобретения компьютеров.
texts.en: Aziz is a 30 year-old man living in the city of Vahdat.  He lives with his parents.  Aziz has a higher education.  He is a programmer and has been working in this field for over ten years.  It has been six years since Aziz opened his own Internet cafe.  His business yields a good income.  Aziz wants to open another Internet cafe.  He is requesting this loan to purchase computers.

loans.use: to purchase computers for his new Internet cafe

loans.name: Moustapha

texts.fr:
Monsieur Moustapha, âgé de 51 ans, est cordonnier de profession. Il a acquis une expérience de plus de 20 ans dans ce métier. Il est marié et père de 5 enfants. Il est à sa deuxième expérience de crédit à l’IMCEC et veut un renouvellement afin de pouvoir acheter de la matière première pour confectionner des chaussures qu’il va revendre lors de la période de la «  korité ».
Moustapha s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne de son foyer. Il aimerait dans l’avenir élargir son activé car la demande s’accroit de jour en jour.
texts.en:
Mr. Moustapha, age 51, is a shoemaker by trade with over 20 years of experience in this field. He is a married father of five children. This is his second loan cycle with IMCEC, and he is seeking this renewal to buy the supplies needed to make shoes that he will sell during the “korité” holidays.

Moustapha is responsible for his household’s daily expenses. His goal is to expand his business in order to meet customer demand, which increases daily.

loans.use: to buy the supplies needed to make shoes for sale.

loans.name: Jesoukpego Group

texts.fr: Le groupe JESOUKPEGO est formé de trois personnes qui sont des amies appartenant à un même groupe de tontine. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Elisabeth Sourou est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Elisabeth Sourou est mariée à un certain Placide. Elisabeth Sourou n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Le couple n’a aucun enfant. Il y a environs dix ans que Elisabeth Sourou exerce comme activité, la coiffure dans son quartier ; ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Parallèlement à cette activité, Elisabeth Sourou vend des tissus et des bijoux. Elisabeth Sourou s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Elisabeth Sourou désire augmenter le stock de ses produits. Pour ce faire, Elisabeth Sourou sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe JESOUKPEGO, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The group JESOUKPEGO comprises three persons who are friends belonging to the same tontine. The group's representative, Elisabeth Sourou, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. This is the first time this group has requested financial support from ALIDé with the aim of boosting business. 

Elisabeth Sourou is married to a man named Placide. She did not attend school. The couple have no children. For about ten years, she has been a hairdresser in her district. This enables her to meet her needs without much problem. Parallel to this work, she sells cloth and jewelry. She gets her supplies from a city in Benin. 

Seeking to respond further to the requirements of her customers, Elisabeth Sourou would like to  increase her stock of products. To do so, she is requesting, along with the other members of the group JESOUKPEGO, a loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to purchase hair care products, cloth, and jewelry to sell

loans.name: Rolando Alfredo

texts.es: Rolando empezó hace 2 años la venta de pescado y camarón, se inicio en este negocio porque al vivir en Libertad zona pesquera varios amigos se dedicaban a esta labor y les dejaba ganancias. Se dedica a este trabajo de lunes a domingo desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche. Lo realiza solo primero comprando el producto en el mercado mayorista para luego venderlo al por menor. El no está casado ni tiene hijos pero se esfuerza para ayudar a sus padres y mejorar su condición de vida. El préstamo que está solicitando es para tener capital para el negocio e invertirlo en la compra de pescado para su venta. A futuro espera poder comprar al por mayor para ser distribuidor en su zona.
texts.en: Rolando started selling fish and shrimp two years ago.  He went into this business because he lives in Libertad which is a fishing zone and several of his friends are in this line of work and it’s profitable.  He works Monday through Sunday from 7am until 7pm.  He works alone first buying the products in the wholesale market and then reselling them at retail.  He is not married and does not have children but strives to help his parents and to improve his living conditions.  The loan he’s requesting is to have capital for his business to invest in the purchase of fish to sell.  In the future he hopes to be able to buy at wholesale and become a distributor in his zone.

loans.use: to buy fish and shrimp.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 23-year-old, married businessman with two children who are both in school. He works in carpentry to earn a living and has been in the business for two years. 

Through his membership with Kiva partner Faulu Kenya, David has learnt how to manage his business by attending business trainings. David is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to buy paint. He dreams of expanding his business and employing people in the future.

loans.use: To buy paint for his carpentry work

loans.name: Levan

texts.en:
Levan is 21 years old and lives with his parents in the Telavi District. His father has chronic health problems and therefore receives a pension from the local government. The family is involved in the dairy business and own two milk cows. Levan’s mother milks the cows every day and produces cheese, which they sell locally. In addition, Levan works at Public Register and receives a monthly salary. Levan is very hard-working person with a great desire to get ahead.

Levan requested a loan to renovate his bathroom that is uncomfortable and damaged. He will use this loan to purchase building materials and make his bathroom comfortable, which will help his family to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase building materials to renovate his bathroom

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 41 years old, married to Susan and blessed with three children. He has been involved in the clothing business for the last five years and earns a monthly income of KES 30,000.

George has applied for a fourth loan from Kiva partner KADET Ltd. for KES 15,000.  He plans to use the loan to purchase additional children’s clothing to sell. George will use the anticipated profits to open another branch of his clothing business.  His future hopes are for his family’s happiness.

loans.use: to purchase more of children's clothing to sell

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a hardworking 47-year-old businesslady with three children. She does tailoring to earn a living. She has been in the business for 20 years and has employed one person.

Lilian previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya, which helped her improve her business. With the income, she was able to support her family. She dreams of buying a piece of land in the future. Lilian has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to buy fabrics.

loans.use: to buy fabrics.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is 40 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has four children, of whom one is currently in school. For the past three years, Justine has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells insecticides and pesticides.

To help expand her business, Justine has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more insecticides and fertilizers, and will help Justine to generate greater profits and will increase the family's income. Justine hopes that in the future she will be able to live a good life and be self reliant. 

Justine is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Justine who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but whose businesses have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more insecticides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Gulimkan

texts.ru:
Гулимкан 59 лет, вдова. Гулимкан в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, на протяжении  16 лет занимается полеводством  и животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 3,000 сом (KGS ). Благодаря упорному труду Гулимкан в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется 6 дойных коров с приплодом, 1 лошадь, ежемесячная прибыль от хозяйства составляет около 6,000 сом (KGS). Также Гулимкан обрабатывает 1,2 га земли, где выращивает люцерну и эспарцет, служащие кормом для скота. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулимкан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота для откорма и перепродажи.  Доходы от кредита Гулимкан планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса посредством увеличения площади посевной земли.
texts.en: Gulimkan is 59 years old and a widow.  To provide the primary source of income for her family, she has been involved in farming and animal husbandry for 16 years, having started this business with a sum of 3,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to Gulimkan's hard work, today her business contains six dairy cows with offspring and one horse, and the monthly profit from the business amounts to about 6,000 som (KGS).  She also works on 1.2 hectares of land, where she grows alfalfa and sainfoin, which serve as livestock feed.  In order to further develop her business, Gulimkan requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy livestock for fattening up and resale.  She plans to invest the earnings into a continued business development by increasing the land area, available for sowing.

loans.use: to buy livestock for fattening up and resale

loans.name: Djromahuton Group

texts.fr: DJROMAHUTON est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Florentine Sèna (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 27 ans et est mariée à un revendeur du nom de Simplice. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Florentine Sèna et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges des enfants. Florentine Sèna n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a près de huit ans que Florentine Sèna mène comme activité la vente de tissus, chaussures et des articles de mercerie dans son atelier. Florentine Sèna exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Florentine Sèna s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Florentine Sèna sollicite un premier crédit avec les autres membres du groupe DJROMAHUTON. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
DJROMAHUTON is a group of three persons whose members reside in the same district in Benin. The group's representative, Florentine Sèna (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 27 years old and married to a retailer named Simplice. The couple have three children, all in school and in their care. She and her husband live together with their children and jointly ensure the different expenses are covered for the children.

Florentine Sèna did not attend school. For nearly eight years, she has been selling cloth, shoes, and sewing supplies in her district. She operates her business with passion, and this enable her to meet her needs and those of her children. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin.

Seeking to satisfy her customers, Florentine Sèna is requesting, along with the other members of the group DJROMAHUTON, an initial loan. This loan will be used to respond better to the demands of their customers and to make more profit.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, sewing supplies, and shoes to sell

loans.name: Cleofe Eufemia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LOS DIAMANTES,la socia continua con su negocio de elaboracion y venta de ataudes,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio,la socia a la vez continua apoyando a su esposo con el negocio de carpinteria , siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia,la socia es una persona emprendedora y responsable ,la socia desea poder continuar trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia economicamente.
La socia solicita el credito para comprar madera para la carpinteria de su esposo.
La socia se siente feliz por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: She belongs to the “Los Diamantes” (The Diamonds) communal bank and continues with her business manufacturing and selling coffins.  She’s been in this business for years and does well thanks to the effort she puts into it.  She also continues supporting her husband’s carpentry shop which is the way she supports her family.  She’s an enterprising, responsible person and wants to be able to continue working in order to continue to support her family economically.  She’s asking for the loan to buy lumber for her husband’s carpentry shop.  She is happy about the granted loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy lumber for her husband's carpentry shop.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar  es un hombre de 29 años de edad,  agricultor , casado, vive con su esposa y su  bebe  en una comunidad de la zona Sur de Costa Rica, ubicada en Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas. La economía local está basada en actividades agropecuarias, donde destaca la siembra de tubérculos, café, maíz, frijoles y ganadería.
Oscar está solicitando un préstamo de ochocientos mil colones (¢800.000) para comprar semilla de maíz y frijoles,  abonos,  insecticidas y fungicidas para  darle mantenimiento a su siembra,  protegerla durante su desarrollo y de esta manera  brindar  productos de calidad a sus clientes, el ingreso económico familiar depende de esta actividad, por lo tanto se esfuerza en realizarla de la mejor manera.
Oscar es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de La Danta S.A, que es una de las 150 empresas de crédito comunal de Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Oscar, 29, works in agriculture.  He’s married and lives with his wife and baby in a community in south Costa Rica located in Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas.  The local economy is based on agriculture and animal husbandry where growing tubers, coffee, corn, beans and cattle raising stand out.

Oscar is asking for an 800,000 (¢800.000) colones loan to buy corn and bean seeds, manure, insecticide and fungicide to provide crop maintenance and protect it during the growing process so that he can provide quality products for his customers.  Family income depends on this activity so he strives to do it in the best way possible.  Oscar is a member of the “La Danta, S.A.” communal bank one of the 150 communal credit firms in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to buy corn and bean seeds as well as farm supplies.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa 3 Group

texts.es:
El comité "Kuña Guapa 3" tiene 15 integrantes, actualmente estan en el 3° ciclo, se dedican a labores distintas pero se ayudan mutuamente para ir saliendo adelante.
La sra. Gloria se dedica a la venta de joyas, con esto ella mantiene a su familia, quiere ampliar la cantidad de sus productos y así satisfacer aún más los pedidos de sus clientes.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de aros, anillos, pulseras, etc.
texts.en:
The Kuña Guapa 3 committee has 15 members and is currently in their 3rd cycle.  The have different businesses but they all help each other get ahead.

Gloria sells jewelry and with it she supports her family.  She would like to increase her products and so be able to fulfill her customers’ order even more.

She is requesting a loan to buy earrings, rings, bracelets, etc.

loans.use: to buy chains, bracelets, rings, earrings, etc

loans.name: Rushadije

texts.en:
Rushadije is a married woman with four children living in the Roma vulnerable ethnic minority community in the southwestern part of Kosovo.

Rushadije’s husband sometimes works for other people, helping with transporting goods in order to earn some income, and Rushadije receives a social pension to supplement his income. Many people from the Roma communities receive these kinds of pensions and live under extremely poor living conditions and lack access to proper health and nutritional care. 

Rushadije’s family owns a small house that has not had any repairs or renovations in the last several years. The flooring in the front of the house is damaged and water, mud, snow, and rain enter the home due to this. The children often get sick during the cold and damp weather. The home is also therefore unable to retain the heat due to the draft that it causes and mold and other bacteria are able to grow and spread.
