It is very important for the health and well being of her family for them to be able to repair the floor and create a better living condition for the family to live comfortably in. 

Rushadije requests a loan to pay for repairing the flooring in the front of her house.
 
The help from the Kiva lenders is greatly appreciated from the family.

loans.use: to pay for repairing the flooring in the front of her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more African clothes for resale.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 25 years old and married with two children that they support. He has been a dairy farmer for the last 7 years, earning a monthly income of 17,000 Kenya shillings (KES).

He has applied for his second loan of 30,000 KES from KADET LTD, with which he plans to purchase dairy food and a water tank, and to pay for labor. 

He will invest the anticipated profits back into his business. His future dreams are to have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase dairy food stuffs and a water tank, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Mwanzia

texts.en: Mwanzia is 35 years old and married with two children who are in school.  He is a hardworking businessman and operates a retail shop to earn a living.  He has engaged in this business for five years.  Mwanzia also does livestock farming to generate more income.   He has learned how to save because Faulu Kenya has trained him on saving skills.  He dreams of operating a wholesale business in the future.  Mwanzia has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy sugar, detergents, maize flour, rice and soft drinks.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in his retail shop.

loans.name: Soledad Katherine

texts.es: Soledad empezó vendiendo productos de belleza por catálogos para luego empezar a vender ropa ya que necesitaba más capital de trabajo. Hace varios años que empezó con esta actividad por lo que ahora tiene un local ubicado en el centro de Libertad. Ella atiende el local desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche que cierra el negocio, oferta los productos como blusas, jeans, pantalonetas, accesorios etc., vendiendo por unidad o por paquetes. Con el crédito que está solicitando va a comprar mercadería para surtir su negocio ya que desea aumentar sus ventas y de esta manera seguir creciendo paulatinamente, como toda persona de negocio su meta es mejorar su condición de vida y seguir desempeñando su trabajo.
texts.en: Soledad started out selling beauty products via catalogue and then started to sell clothes because she needed more working capital.  She started this activity several years ago and now has a locale in downtown Libertad.  She is open for business from 7 in the morning until 7 in the evening when she closes the store.  She sells blouses, jeans, shorts, accessories, etc. either by the unit or in packages.  She will use the loan she’s requesting to buy merchandise to stock the store because she wants to increase sales to continue gradually growing.  Like all businesspeople, her goal is to improve her living conditions and to continue developing her work.

loans.use: to buy clothes and accessories.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LOS DIAMANTES,la socia continua con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes ella vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz,azucar,leche,golosinas,gaseosas entre otros,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia es una persona responsable y emprendedora siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando ya que de esta manera puede seguir apoyando economicamente  a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de mercaderia como arroz ,leche y azucar.
La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the LOS DIAMANTES communal bank. She still has her business, a store selling groceries. She sells different types of products, such as rice, sugar, milk, snacks, and soft drinks, among others. She has spent a long time in this business, which is going well thanks to the hard work she puts into her business every day. She wants to be able to keep working, since this way she can keep supporting her family financially. 

She is asking for the loan to buy merchandise such as rice, milk and sugar. She is grateful for the loan and committed to making the established payments.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as rice, milk and sugar.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité "Mujeres Unidas" tiene 26 integrantes y se encuentra en su décimo segundo ciclo; todas ellas trabjan arduamente para salir adelante, son personas muy emprendedoras y que luchan por sus ideales y el binestar de los suyos.
María tiene un almacén, el cual es bien surtido y con el que mantiene a su familia. Ella se esfuerza todos los días para solventar los gastos de la casa y también para surtir aún mas su despensa y satisfacer a su clientela.
Solicitó el crédito para comprar aceites, panes, leches, cigarrillos, caramelos, gaseosas y poder ofrecer a su clientela mas variedades de productos.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Unidas” (United Women) committee has 26 members and they are in their 12th cycle.  They all work hard to get ahead.  They are very enterprising and fight for their ideals and for their loved ones’ wellbeing.

María has a grocery store that’s well-stocked and that she supports her family with.  She strives every day to cover household expenses and also to stock her store even better to satisfy her customers.

She asked for the loan to buy oil, baked goods, dairy goods, cigarettes, candy and soft-drinks to be able to offer her customers more varied products.

loans.use: to buy oil, bread, cigarettes, soft-drinks, etc.

loans.name: Musili

texts.en:
Musili is 36 years old, married man with five children who all attend school. He works in livestock farming to earn a living. He has been in this business for ten years and employs one person. 

Musili previously acquired a loan from Kiva partner Faulu Kenya that helped him improve his business and educate his children. He has requested for new loan of 20,000 KES to buy a cow. Musili dreams of owning more cows in the future.

loans.use: To buy a cow for his livestock farming work

loans.name: Nzara

texts.en:
Nzara is a very enterprising person who is 100% dedicated to her business. She lives with her husband and 8 children in the town of Tiribe. She earns a living by selling locally brewed drinks, and she has been doing this for the last 15 years. She also helps her husband with his farming during her free time.

Nzara tells us that her residential house is not in a good condition, so she is requesting a loan in the amount of KES 10,000 to renovate her house. She will reinvest the rest in their farming business.

Nzara hopes to improve her income so that she can have a better quality of life. Her dream is to open a retail shop.

loans.use: To renovate her house and reinvest the rest into her farming business

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en:
Matilda is 38 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda.  She is married and has three children who are all currently in school.  For the past four years, Matilda has been working hard to manage her boutique, which sells mens and ladies clothing. 

To help expand her business, Matilda has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to buy more shoes and clothing to sell, and will help Matilda to generate greater profits which will lead to increased income for her family.  Matilda hopes that in the future she will be able to live a good life free from poverty. 

Matilda is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Matilda who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more shoes and clothing to sell.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence operates a retail shop to earn a living.  She previously acquired a loan of 40,000 KES from Faulu Kenya which helped her add stock to her business.  With the additional income that she generated, she was able to educate her children.  Florence has requested a loan of 80,000 KES to add more stock of sugar, maize flour, rice and detergents to her store.

loans.use: To buy stock for her retail shop.

loans.name: Nonvignon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe NONVIGNON est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Yélomè Viviane, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Yélomè Viviane est mariée à un certain Georges. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charges. Le couple vit ensemble avec leurs enfants et subvient ensemble aux divers besoins de la famille. Yélomè Viviane a arrêté l’école au cours primaire. Il y a près de neuf ans que Yélomè Viviane exerce comme activité, la vente des condiments et du pain à son domicile ; ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Yélomè Viviane désire renforcer et diversifier son activité. Pour ce faire, Yélomè Viviane sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe NONVIGNON, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The group NONVIGNON comprises three persons who reside in the same district in Benin. The group's representative, Yélomè Viviane, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. This is the second time this group has requested financial support from ALIDé to boost business. 

Yélomè Viviane is married to a man named Georges. The couple have two children, both in school with one in their care. The couple live together with their children and jointly meet the diverse needs of the family. 

Yélomè Viviane dropped out of elementary school. For nearly nine years, she has been selling condiments and bread out of her home. This enables her to meet her family's needs without much problem. 

Concerned about responding better to the demands of her customers, Yélomè Viviane would like to bolster and diversify her business. To do so, she is requesting, along with the other members of the group NONVIGNON, a second loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy condiments and bread to sell from home

loans.name: Monique Afiavi

texts.fr: Monique Afiavi est âgée de 45 ans et vit au Bénin. Monique Afiavi est mariée à un technicien du nom de Philippe. Le couple a trois enfants à leur charge, tous scolarisés. Monique Afiavi vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec son mari, les charges de la maison. Afin d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Monique Afiavi mène comme activité depuis une quinzaine d’année, la vente de friperies de façon ambulante. Parallèlement à cette activité, Monique Afiavi vend des glacières et bols. Monique Afiavi s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin et au Nigeria. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Monique Afiavi sollicite pour la quatrième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt lui permettra certainement de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de se faire plus de profits. Les crédits antérieurs reçus par Monique Afiavi ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Monique Afiavi is 45 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to a technician named Philippe, and the couple have three dependent children who all go to school. Monique Afiavi lives with her husband and children, and the couple handle the various household responsibilities together. To that end, Monique Afiavi started selling second-hand clothing door-to-door about 15 years ago. As a secondary activity, she also sells coolers and bowls. She buys her merchandise in a city of Benin, and in Nigeria. 

To achieve customer satisfaction and to increase her sales and revenue, Monique Afiavi is seeking financial assistance from ALIDé for the fourth time. This credit will help her to bolster her activity and increase her profits. All three past loans were repaid without incident.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing, coolers and bowls for resale.

loans.name: Neptali

texts.es: Neptali, tiene 27 años de edad, vive en el municipio de Morazan Yoro, junto a su esposa y una hija. el se a dedicado a realizar trabajos agrícolas, y tiene 3 años de haber comenzado a realizar otras actividades para generar más ingresos al hogar. El compra cerdos y los destaza para vender la carne y también vende refrescos, y topogigios (helados). El préstamo que solicita es para comprar dos cerdos y refrescos para la venta, así puede seguir trabajando para el sostenimiento de su familia. Su meta es mantener estable siempre el negocio para poderle dar a su hija lo que necesite.
texts.en:
Neptalí, 27, lives in the municipality of Morazán, Yoro with his wife and daughter.   He works in agriculture and for the last three years has been doing other things too to earn more household income.  He buys pigs that he butchers to sell the meat and he also sells soft-drinks and topogigios (frozen treats).

The loan he’s requesting is to buy two pigs and soft-drinks to sell so that he can continue working to support his family.  His goal is to keep his businesses stable always to be able to give his daughter whatever she may need.

loans.use: to buy pigs to butcher and soft-drinks to sell.

loans.name: Rincon Guazu Poty Group

texts.es:
El comité "Rincon Guazu Poty" tiene 10 integrantes quienes se dedican a actividades diversas y con esfuerzo y ganas de sobresalir y un futuro mejor trabajan arduamente.
Laura, una de las integrantes del grupo, se dedica a la venta de comidas, con ésto ella ayuda al sustento familiar y a un futuro mas próspero para su familia y el de ella.
Con el crédito podrá comprar verduras, hortalizas, carnes, leches, huevos, y demás productos para poder realizar sus comidas y venderlas a su clientela.
texts.en:
The "Rincon Guazu Poty" committee has 10 members who work in different activities with hard work and eager to get ahead and have a better future. They work very hard.  

Laura is one of the members of the group. She sells food. With this she helps support her family and with having a more prosperous future for her and her family. 

With the loan, she will be able to buy produce, vegetables, meat, milk, eggs and other products to be able to make her foods and sell them to her customers.

loans.use: to buy produce, oils, eggs, meat, etc.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 29 years old and lives in Mukono, Uganda. She is single and has one child who is currently in school. For the past 8 years, Rose has been working hard to manage her boutique where she sells women’s clothing. 

Rose has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UGX from Kiva partner BRAC Uganda to help expand her business.  She will use the loan to buy materials to make more blouses and suits for sale.  The increase in clothing stock will help Rose to generate greater profits and change her family's life. Rose hopes that in the future she will be able to have a big business. 

Rose is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Rose who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy material to make blouses and suits to sell

loans.name: Haxhere

texts.en:
Haxhere is a married thirty-year-old woman with four children. She lives in a small village in Kosovo. Until now, she used to live with her husband’s brother and his family, but they have recently been able to move out into their own home. 

Her husband cuts wood and sells it for heating purposes as a way of making a living. Their family is also involved in an agricultural business. They keep cows so as to avoid paying for the 5 liters of milk each day that is necessary to provide for her children and family. 

For the first time, she is requesting a loan to buy another cow.

In the future, Haxhere hopes to renovate her stable and to add more cows. Her goal is to improve her life and offer her children a better and healthy life.

She is very thankful to Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Ndèye Fatou

texts.fr:
Ndèye Fatou est une jeune coiffeuse de 24 ans, célibataire sans enfant. Elle travaille dans ce domaine depuis 5 ans. Ndèye Fatou  loue un studio non loin de chez elle et travaille avec une de ses amies. Elle a un peu de matériel mais à toujours besoin de se connecter à la nouvelle mode c’est la raison pour laquelle, elle vient solliciter un crédit de 100000F CFA pour rééquiper son salon.
Elle n’a pas de charges car elle vit avec ses parents.
Comme projets elle aimerait ouvrir son propre salon de coiffure.
texts.en:
Ndèye Fatou is young hairdresser, 24 years old, unmarried, and without children. She has been working in this domain for five years. She leases a studio not far from her home and works with  one of her friends. She has little equipment but always needs to be in touch with new styles. For these reasons, she is here to requested a loan of 100,000 francs CFA to re-equip her salon. 

She has no dependents because she lives with her parents.

As for her plans, she would like to open her own hair salon.

loans.use: to purchase hairdressing supplies for the salon where she works

loans.name: Wangninan Group

texts.fr: WANGNINAN est un groupe de quatre personnes, dont les membres résident dans la même zone au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Sidonie (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 35 ans et est mariée à un certain René. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Sidonie et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges des enfants. Sidonie n’a pas été l’école. Depuis quinze ans, Sidonie mène comme activité la vente de divers produits (pâtes dentifrices, pétrole et charbon de bois) devant une école publique du Bénin. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à ainsi faire face aux besoins de ses enfants. Sidonie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Sidonie sollicite un deuxième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe WANGNINAN. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Le premier crédit a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
WANGNINAN is a group of four persons whose members reside in the same area in Benin. The group's representative, Sidonie (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 35 years old and married to a man named René. The couple have three children, all in school and in their care. She and her husband live together with their children and jointly ensure that the different expenses are covered for the children. 

Sidonie did not go to school. For fifteen years, she has been selling a variety of goods (toothpaste, kerosene, and charcoal) in front of a public school in Benin. This business generates revenues, thus helping her to cope with the needs of her children. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 
  
Seeking to satisfy her customers, Sidonie is requesting, along with the other members of the group WANGNINAN, a second loan. This loan will be used for responding better to the demands of their customers and for making more profit. The first loan was indeed paid back.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal and kerosene to sell

loans.name: Belinda Yaneth

texts.es: Belinda, tiene 38 años de edad, es casada, tiene 3 hijos y vive en el municipio de la Masica, Atlántida. Belinda tiene más de 4 años de haber iniciado su propio negocio, donde vende desayunos, almuerzos y cenas. el negocio lo tiene en su casa, ella quiere continuar trabajando y para eso ha solicitado un préstamo por 21,000 Lempiras para comprar los insumos que necesita para la elaboración de comidas, como es la carne, harina, verduras, lácteos, azúcar, arroz, frijoles, aceite, refrescos, etc.asi ella podrá cubrir la demanda diaria que tiene en su negocio. Su meta es hacer crecer el negocio y ver a sus hijos graduados.
texts.en: Belinda, 38, is married and has three children.  She lives in Masica, Atlántida.  She started her own business more than four years ago.  She sells breakfasts, lunches and dinners.  The business is located in her house.  She wants to continue working which is why she’s asking for a 21,000 Lempira loan to buy ingredients like meat, flour, vegetables, dairy products, sugar, rice, beans, oil, soft-drinks, etc., she needs for her food preparation. She will be able to cover her business’ daily demand this way.  Her goal is to make the business grow and to see her children graduate.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food preparation.

loans.name: Lita

texts.es:
Lita tiene 49 años, es una mujer amable, muy buena y emprendedora. Su pareja es Tolentino, de 53 años, con quien tiene cinco hijos, de los cuales cuatro ya son mayores y gracias a sus sabios consejos son personas provechosas para la sociedad, sólo María, que tiene 15 años y es la única que aún depende de ellos para su educación. 

La actividad principal de Lita es la venta de comida, lo que realiza en su casa, donde ha acondicionado un espacio cómodo para atender a sus comensales. Todos los días sale muy temprano al mercado en busca de los ingredientes e insumos frescos para preparar sus comidas. Lleva realizando este trabajo por 6 años, lo hace sola, ya que por el momento no considera necesario la ayuda de ningún personal. Le esta yendo muy bien, genera buenas ventas diarias y por tanto tiene buenos ingresos, los cuales utiliza para poder cubrir las principales necesidades de su familia. Desde hace un tiempo ha comenzado a expandir su negocio y ahora trabaja también vendiendo desayunos en las mañanas, motivo por el cual se le hace necesario adquirir, lo más pronto posible, algunos artículos y accesorios que requiere en su cocina para continuar preparando sus comidas.

Este es su crédito número 17 con MFP y está muy contenta por el apoyo financiero que le están brindando, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Por otro lado, se compromete a continuar pagando puntualmente sus cuotas, tal como le programen. Y está muy feliz de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos son muy responsables y solidarios.

Con el monto solicitado, 1500 soles, comprará ingredientes e insumos, al por mayor, como arroz, aceite, azúcar, fideos, tubérculos y condimentos. Asimismo comprará dos mesas más y ocho sillas para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Lita is 49 years odl. She is a kind woman who is very kind and enterprising. Her spouse is Tolentino. He is 53 and she has five children with him. Four of them are grown and thanks to her wise advice they are people who are good members of society. Only María, who is 15 years old, is the only one who still depends on them for her education.

Lita's main activity is selling food that she makes at home. She has set up a space to serve her guests. Everyday she goes to the market very early seeking fresh ingredients and materials to prepare her foods. She has been doing this job for 6 years. She does it alone since at this time she doesn't consider that she needs any personnnel.  It is going very well for her. She generates good daily sales and therefore good income. She uses them to be able to cover the main necessities of her family. A while ago she started expanding her business and now she also sells breakfasts in the morning. That is why it has become necessary to acquire, as soon as possible. some items and accesories that she needs to continue making her foods. 

This is her 17th loan with MFP and she is very happy with the financial support that is being offered to her. With it she will feel safe going ahead with her work. On the other hand, she is committed to making her payments on time, as has been scheduled. She is also very happy to belong to her communal bank, since they are very responsible and supportive. 

With the ammount she has asked for, 1500 soles, she will buy ingredients and materials wholesale, such as rice, oil, sugar, pasta, tubers and condiments. In addition, she will buy two more and eight chairs for her customers.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and materials wholesale, such as rice, oil, sugar, pasta, tubers and condiments. In addition she will buy two more tables and eight chairs for her customers.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is an entrepreneur who is widowed and has three children. She runs a food stall where she sells a variety of dishes and beverages. Since she does not depend on anyone, she is aware that she has to work extra hard to provide for her children. 

Agnes requests a loan to buy ingredients such as wheat flour, rice, beans, and other spices so she can offer a wider variety of dishes to her customers. She hopes to continue educating her children so they can be successful in life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like wheat flour, rice, beans, and other spices for her food stall.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is 25 years old and married with three school-going children.  She has been earning a living over the past two years by buying and selling a variety of seedlings, earning a monthly income of KES 7,000.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 10,000 from KADET LTD, which she plans to use to purchase more stock of maize, bean and pea seedlings.  She will invest the anticipated profits back into her business.  Her future dreams are to have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase more seedlings for re-sale.

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a hardworking businessman who is married with five children who are in school. He operates a butcher shop in a competitive environment with reliable customers. He has been in the business for 15 years and has employed two people. In addition, George is an electrician. George has a dream of owning real estate in the future. He has requested a loan of 80,000 KES to build a house.

loans.use: To build a house

loans.name: Angel Gabriel

texts.es: Angel de 56 años de edad es esposo y padre de 2 hijos en las edades de 26 y 32 años, familia por la cual dirige sus esfuerzos para que logren cada vez mas bienestar; él es propietario de un taller de ebanistería  desde hace 14 años, pues hace 17 aprendió con su tío y con su experiencia emprendió su aventura de negocios, organizando un taller que gradualmente ha crecido y que hoy maneja una amplia clientela que compra a él puertas, ventanas, escaparates y armarios principalmente.  Sus ventas las realiza de contado y sus ventas tienen una frecuencia semanal; Ángel trabaja diariamente durante todo el día, con pequeños descansos para alimentarse, sus clientes  solicitan el producto, él lo interpreta y presenta en dibujo, hace la cotización, compra las materias primas, diseña el producto, prepara, corta la madera, ensambla y da acabado al producto, que finalmente vende de contado y  directamente a sus consumidores, que son principalmente, empleados, e instituciones que solicitan su servicio, porque lo conocen y obtienen un buen precio. En la actualidad su principal desafío es adecuar locativamente su taller, pues la cubierta  está en mal estado y el piso necesita repararlo para trabajar de manera segura y mucho más cómoda. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual realizará los trabajos constructivos que requiere su taller, al que poco a poco quiere dotarlo de maquinaria y equipos y fortalecerlo mucho mas, porque es su fuente principal de ingresos con el que planea aumentar el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Ángel, 56, is a husband and father of two children who are 26 and 32 years old, a family for whom he directs all his efforts so that they will acquire more wellbeing every day. 

He has owned a cabinet-making shop for 14 years because 17 years ago he learned from his uncle and with the experience gained started his own business venture.  He set up a shop that has gradually grown and today he has a large clientele that buys doors, windows, cupboards and armoires mainly.  He sells for cash and his sales are weekly.  Ángel works all day, every day.  He takes small breaks to eat.  His customers request the product and he interprets it, presents a drawing and a price quote, assembles and finishes the item which he finally sells for cash directly to consumers who are mostly employees and institutions that request his services because they know him and get good prices.

His current challenge is to make some physical improvements to his shop because the roof is in poor shape and the floor needs to be repaired in order to work safely and more comfortably.  This is the reason for requesting a Kiva loan, his first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that he will use to carry out the construction projects his shop needs.  He gradually wants to equip his shop with machinery and equipment and to strengthen it much more because it’s his main source of income he plans to use to increase his family’s wellbeing.

loans.use: to make some physical improvements to his shop like repair the roof and the floor.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim is a 40 year old bakery owner in Mariakani, Kenya. He is a married father of four. He has been running the bakery business for the past two years and he is doing great.

This loan is Salim’s first from Kiva partner KADET Ltd. He plans to use the loan to purchase an oven, baking flour, and cooking oil. Salim will use the anticipated profits to educate his children and provide for the basic needs of his family. In the future, he hopes to have a well-established business.

loans.use: to purchase an oven, baking flour, and cooking oil for his bakery business

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is 35 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has three children with two of them currently in school. For the past four years, Rehema has been working hard to manage her retail shop, where she sells foodstuffs like sugar and rice. 

To help expand her business, Rehema has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more rice, beans and other common Ugandan foods. This will help Rehema to generate greater profits and increase her income, which will enhance her standard of living. Rehema hopes that in the future, she will be able to be self reliant and productive. 

Rehema is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Rehema who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more rice, beans and other common Ugandan foods

loans.name: Job

texts.en: Job is a hardworking 27-year-old businessman. He runs a taxi transport business to earn a living. For three years, he has been operating this business in a busy environment with reliable customers. Since Job became a client of Faulu Kenya, he has become financially knowledgeable through the business training he attended. He dreams of buying a piece of land in the future. Job has requested a loan of 45,000 KES to buy spare parts and service his vehicle.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and service his vehicle

loans.name: Jackquiline

texts.en:
Jacqueiline is 41 years old and single with three children. She has been running a second-hand clothing business for the last three years, earning a monthly income of KES 27,250.

She has applied for her second loan of KES 45,000 from KADET LTD, which she plans to use to purchase more stock of dresses, shorts and skirts for sale.

With the anticipated profit she plans to open another branch. Her future hope is to have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of dresses, shorts and skirts.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 31 years old, married and has two children. He collects and sells scrap metals which he sells for recycling.  He has employed three people in his business.  He also does farming for extra income generation. Through Faulu Kenya, he has learnt how to save his money. He has also grown his business because he has been trained on business management skills.

Peter has requested 100,000 KES to buy scrap metals for recycling.

loans.use: To buy scrap metal for recycling

loans.name: Life Group

texts.en:
There are two women in this group. Their ages are 54 years and 55 years. One is married and the other is single. They are selling bags, sandals, cosmetics and soft drinks. They meet on Friday at Teshie to discuss their business.

Lydia is a 54-year-old single woman who sells bags and cosmetics. This is her third loan. Her previous loan was for 500 Ghana cedis, which she paid promptly. She finished paying her third loan on 27/07/2012 and now she needs Kiva's support for a loan of 750 Ghana cedis to buy more bags and cosmetics to sell to customers.  She needs support so that she can meet her customer's demands.

The group needs a total sum of 1,300 Ghana cedis to be able to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy more bags and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Isabel Cristina

texts.es: Isabel de 59 años de edad, tiene un pequeño taller de confecciones desde hace 10 años, donde fabrica vestidos femeninos y elabora especialmente  productos de lencería para el hogar, como forros para licuadoras, cortinas, cubrelechos, y accesorios femeninos, como vinchas, bolsos, fajones y disfraces que elabora con mayor énfasis en la época del Carnaval de Barranquilla.  Isabel aprendió este arte  en un colegio religioso donde estudió, el que enfatizaba las manualidades; sus primeros pasos los dio  fabricando  disfraces para sus propios hijos, hoy en las edades de 26 y 31 años. Sus ventas las realiza directamente a sus clientes y no utiliza intermediarios, los principales productos son disfraces y productos de lencería, ella usualmente quiere acceder a descuentos especiales de sus proveedores, porque su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para obtener precios excepcionales y trasladarlos a su oferta, haciéndola cada vez más competitiva.  Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  con el cual comprará insumos y materias primas para producir prendas de vestir, disfraces y accesorios en tela.  Sus ventas las realizan en las dos modalidades de crédito y de contado, inicia sus actividades desde las 8 de la mañana y las extiende usualmente hasta las 5 de la tarde, aunque en tiempo en el cual   incrementan su producción, porque hay mucha demanda en el mercado.  Sus principales clientes son amigos y los referidos de estos, que apoyan su gestión voz a voz porque conocen la calidad de las prendas  que Isabel elabora. Isabel disfruta su trabajo y lo asume como una terapia de relajación, vive en la actualidad con su hija que muy pronto viajará a Canadá y con su esposo que es pensionado de una empresa.
texts.en:
Isabel is 59 years old. For the past ten years she has had a small workshop where she makes women's clothing and lingerie items for the home such as blender liners, curtains, and bedspreads. She also makes feminine accessories like headbands, handbags, and costumes, which she makes with greater emphasis during the season of Carnaval in Barranquilla.  

Isabel learned this art when she was a student at a religious school that emphasized crafts. At first she made costumes for her own children, who are now 26 and 31 years old. She sells her products directly to customers and does not use intermediaries. Her main items are costumes and lingerie products.

Isabel wants to access special discounts from her material providers. Her working capital is not enough to obtain exceptional prices and transfer them to her work in order to become more competitive. This is why she is requesting this loan, her first funding request with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. With this loan, she will purchase inputs and primary materials for producing garments, costumes, and fabric accessories. 

In her sales Isabel uses both credit and cash. She begins her activities at 8am and usually works until 5pm, and with time she is increasing her production as there is much demand in the market. Her main customers are friends and those referred to her by friends, who support her development by word of mouth because they know the quality of her products. 

Isabel enjoys her job and takes it as relaxation therapy. She currently lives with her daughter who will very soon travel to Canada, and with her husband who works for a company.

loans.use: to purchase inputs and primary materials for producing garments, costumes, and fabric accessories.

loans.name: Vera Judith

texts.es: Vera de 39 años de edad vive en una casa al lado del mar en el corregimiento de Salgar, con sus dos hijos en las edades de 11 y 14 años.   Ella es propietaria de una miscelánea donde vende mercancía variada, de la cual deriva sus ingresos para el sustento de su hogar, los principales artículos en su exhibición son los perfumes, la papelería, ropa y calzado, los cuales vende a crédito y de contado principalmente; la mayor parte de su clientela habita en Salgar y en el área urbana de Puerto Colombia, municipio cercano. Vera también aprovecha la visita de los turistas los fines de semana, para vender cervezas, refrescos y comidas especialmente platos marinos, pues tiene un Kiosco a orillas del mar. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará mercancía variada, para atender los pedidos de sus clientes y para tener entre sus inventarios los artículos de mayor rotación entre su clientela como accesorios femeninos ropa y calzado. Su meta es lograr educar a sus hijos hasta llevarlos a ser profesionales y ampliar la miscelánea, hasta convertirla en un  almacén muy reconocido en su población y esto es lo que planea alcanzar gradualmente con este credikiva y los   posteriores a él.
texts.en:
Vera, 39, lives in a house on the seashore in Corregimiento de Salgar with her two children who are 11 and 14 years of age.  She owns a variety store where she sells assorted merchandise earning income to support her household.  The main items on display are perfume, stationery supplies, clothes and footwear that she sells both for cash and on credit.  Most of her customers live in Salgar and in the urban area of Puerto Colombia, a nearby municipality.  Vera also takes advantage of weekend tourism to sell beer, soft-drinks and food, especially seafood, since she has a kiosk at the seashore.

She’s currently applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy assorted merchandise to fill customer orders and to have more of the items that sell best like women’s accessories, clothes and footwear in inventory available for her customers.

Her goal is to provide schooling for her children all the way to professional level and to expand her variety store to turn it into a well-known store in her location.  This is what she plans to accomplish with this Kiva loan and with others subsequent to it.

loans.use: to buy assorted merchandise like women's accessories, clothes and footwear.

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario De San Sebastian Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece  al banco comunal VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO DE SAN SEBASTIAN; este banco está situado en el distrito de  Wanchaq en la provincia  de Cusco departamento de Cusco.

La socia Felipa ,la socia tiene 40 años de edad, casada y tiene 01 hijo, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de artesanía ,la socia elabora tejidos como chompas,chalinas,guantes,chuyos entre otros, la socia trabaja de forma independiente en su negocio distribuyendo su mercadería a sus clientes que más le solicitan, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de materiales como lanas de diferentes colores.

Los otros socios se dedican a la venta de muebles, venta de repuestos de vehículos, artesania, mecánica, carpineteria, ganadería.

Las personas que salen adjuntas en la foto pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunion por motivos de trabajo.

La socia se  siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete  a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO DE SAN SEBASTIAN, which is located in the district of Wanchaq in Cusco province, Cusco department. Felipa, 40, is married and has a son. Her daily activities include making handicrafts and weavings such as sweaters, shawls, gloves, hats, and other items. She works alone, selling her merchandise to her best customers. She has years of experience in this business, which prospers due to her efforts. She is responsible and dedicated to providing for her family. She is requesting a loan to buy materials such as different colors of wool.

The other members' professions include: selling furniture, auto parts, or handicrafts; mechanics; carpentry; and raising livestock. The people who appear in the inset photos asked permission to arrive late for the meeting due to their work schedules. Felipa is grateful for the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy materials such as different colors of wool.

loans.name: Miracle Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of 11 female members, ranging in age from 24 to 56 years old. The group has been working together for three years.  Seven of the members are married with children, two are married without children, and one member is single with one child. The group sells fish, eggs, electrical appliances, provisions, clothing, yams, and plastic chairs. These items are displaced in the photograph. They all live in the same neighborhood so they know each other very well. This is their first loan cycle with Kiva partner ID-Ghana. They need a total amount of 3,250 GHS to improve their business.

Naomi is a 40-year-old married woman with 4 children and lives with her family in Teshie. She works as part of the group and sells yams and provisions. She has been doing this job for two years with a monthly profit of 90 GHS. She uses part of her earnings for family expenses and the remaining part for reinvestment. Naomi will use her portion of the loan to buy more yams and provisions from the market to supply the customers in Teshie.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and yams to sell to customers.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 32 two years old and single with one child. She been running a clothing business for the last six years earning a monthly income of KES 7,800.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 10,000 from KADET LTD, which she plans to use to purchase more children's wear such as underwear, socks and sweaters. 

With the anticipated profit she plans to open another branch. Her future hope is to have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase more children's wear such as underwear, socks and sweaters

loans.name: Ega

texts.en:
Ega is married and the mother of three children who attend a local school. Ega has a retail shop where she has been selling flour, rice, sugar, and other grocery items for over five years. She gets her supplies from the nearby town and maintains a large number of customers.

Experienced with loans, she requested and obtained financing from Yehu with the aim of satisfying customer needs and increasing her profit. The profit generated will enable her to help with her children's schooling and to help her provide her family with a quality life.

Ega is requesting this loan to purchase rice, flour, detergents, and other fast selling items.

loans.use: to purchase rice, flour, detergents, and other fast selling items.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene lives in the Kongowea area of Coast province, Kenya. She is single. She owns a maize-selling business, a business she has been operating for one year. Apart from this, she earns a salary from her rental houses. 

She learned about Milango through an employee who invited her to the group and she joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve the business operations. The challenge she is facing is the high price for the maize.

Irene is applying for a loan of 43,150 Kenya shillings to purchase additional maize. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to pay school fees for her children. Her plan for the future is to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of maize.

loans.name: Selpha

texts.en:
Selpha is 45 years old, married to Wilberforce and blessed with six children. She is a tailor, a business she started 12 years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 8,000.

She is requesting her first loan of KES  20,000 to purchase another sewing machine. The profit she earns from it will help her expand her business as well as educate her children. 

She hopes to see her business expand and educate her children to higher levels.

loans.use: To purchase another sewing machine

loans.name: Pirmurod

texts.ru: Пирмурод родился 1968 году в районе Рудаки, который находится недалеко от города Вахдат. Он живет с женой. Пирмурод предоставляет услугу. Он работает таксистом. В этой области Пирмурод четыре года. Он просит кредит для ремонта машины.
texts.en: Pirmurod was born in 1968 in the Rudaki region, which is located near the city of Vahdat. Currently, he lives together with his wife. For the past four years, Pirmurod has been offering taxi services. He is requesting this loan to repair his automobile.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle

loans.name: Abdurozik

texts.ru: Абдурозик житель города Вахдат. Ему 26 лет. Он женат. Абдурозик более трех лет работает таксистом. Этот вид деятельности является единственным источником дохода. Абдурозик просит кредит для приобретения запчастей, чтобы заменить старые запчасти.
texts.en: Abdurozik lives in the city of Vahdat. He is 26 years old and married. For over three years, Abdurozik has been working as a taxi driver. This activity is his only source of income. Abdurozik is requesting this loan to purchase spare parts in order to replace worn out components of his car.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts

loans.name: Lorreine

texts.es:
Lorreine tiene 49 años, es una mujer trabajadora y muy responsable. Está casada con Estanis, de 62 años, con quien tiene cuatro hijos a quienes crió y educó hasta que se hicieron independientes. Ahora ella vive al lado de su esposo, en su casa propia, donde comparten sus días con las ganas de trabajar mucho para tener una mejor calidad de vida.

Ella se dedica a la confección y arreglo de prendas de vestir. Trabaja en su casa, donde espera la llegada de sus vecinos, amigos o personas conocidas que tengan la necesidad de obtener alguna prenda exclusiva o que sencillamente requieran de alguna labor pequeña como enmendar alguna prenda descosida, colocar un botón en alguna camisa o pantalón, o colocar un cierre. Lleva en este trabajo más de 10 años y lo hace con una máquina de coser antigua y vieja a la cual guarda mucho cariño por considerarla su fiel compañera de trabajo. Brinda siempre una agradable atención y es muy detallista y observadora, cualidad que le ha servido para culminar su trabajo con una excelente calidad en los acabados. Paralelo a esta actividad, de manera ocasional, vende ropa de segundo uso por la ribera de los ríos desde hace 2 años y también le va muy bien. Por si fuera poco, también trabaja por las mañanas en un aserradero de la ciudad, lo cual incrementa sus ingresos. Ahora espera establecer un negocio de costura mucho más completo y para iniciar este sueño necesita comprar una máquina de coser nueva.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y está muy contenta al saber que tiene un apoyo financiero que le brinde la garantía para continuar trabajando con mucha tranquilidad. Por su parte se compromete a seguir siendo una socia puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, así como lo hizo en anteriores créditos que tuvo.

Con el monto solicitado, 800 soles, comprará una máquina de coser nueva con remalladora, cuesta aproximadamente 700 soles. Con el monto restante comprará algunos materiales de costura como telas, hilos, botones y agujas.
texts.en:
Lorreine, 49, is a hardworking and responsible woman.  She is married to Estanis, 62, and together they have 4 children that they raised and educated and are now independent.  Lorreine now lives with her husband in her own home, where they share their days with a desire to work hard in order to have a better quality of life.

Lorreine has a business making and repairing garments.  She works in her house, where she awaits the arrival of her friends, neighbors and personal acquaintances who need to buy an exclusive garment, or who simply need some small mending work done such as mending a split seam, putting a button on a shirt or pair of pants, or putting in a zipper.  She has been doing this work for 10 years, and she does it with an old sewing machine that she keeps that she is very fond of, as she considers it to be her loyal work companion.  She always provides friendly service, and she is very thorough and observant, qualities that have enabled her to complete her work with excellent quality finishes.  Alongside this activity, she sometimes also sells used clothing at that bank of the river.  She has been doing this for 2 years, and this business has also done very well.  And if that weren't enough, she also works in the mornings in a sawmill in the city, which increases her income.  Now she is hoping to establish a dressmaking business that is much more complete, and to do this she needs to buy a new sewing machine.

This is Lorreine's third loan with MFP, and she is very content to know that she has financial support, guaranteeing her the ability to continue working with a lot of tranquility.  On her part, she promises to continue being punctual with her loan payments, as she was with the previous loans that she took.  With the sum of 800 Peruvian soles that she requests, she will buy a new sewing machine with a serger that costs about 700 soles.  With the rest of the money, she will buy some dressmaking supplies such as fabric, thread, buttons and needles.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and dressmaking supplies, such as: fabric, thread, buttons and needles

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. He is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past seven years, Patrick has been working hard to manage his small business, which sells motor spare parts. 

To help expand his business, Patrick has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more brake shoes, side mirrors, tires, and other auto parts, and will help Patrick to generate greater profits and then invest more in his business. Patrick hopes that in the future he will be able to sell more products. 

Patrick is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Patrick who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more brake shoes, side mirrors, tires, and other auto parts

loans.name: Olive

texts.en: Olive is 31 years old. She is a mother of three children, and all go to school. She sells beans and sorghum and has been in the business for the past five years. With the loan, she wants to buy more sorghum and beans to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay the school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more beans and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 39 years old, married with four children. She has been running a green grocery business for the last two years, earning a monthly income of KES 20,000.

She has applied for her third loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD, which she plans to use to purchase more stock of green vegetables, carrots and potatoes. 

The anticipated profits will be used to invest back into her business. Her future dreams are to have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of green vegetables, carrots and potatoes.

loans.name: Wangari

texts.en:
Wangari is 26 years old, married  with two children. She has been running a general store  for the last nine years, earning a monthly income of KES 45,000 .

She has applied for her first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD, which she plans to use to purchase more stock of sugar, rice and flour for sale. 

The anticipated profits will be invested back into her business. Her future dreams are to have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of sugar, rice and flour for the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cows and goats.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. He is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past five years, Ibrahim has been working hard to manage his retail shop where he sells rice, biscuits, soda and flour. 

To help expand his business, Ibrahim has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more oil, rice and other goods for his business and will help Ibrahim to generate greater profits and allow him to buy more goods to sell. Ibrahim hopes that in the future, he will be able to sell more quality products. 

Ibrahim is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ibrahim who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more oil, rice and other goods for his business

loans.name: Chynarkul

texts.ru:
Чынаркул 50 лет, одна воспитала 4 детей. Чынаркул работает учителем кыргызского языка в школе села Боконбаево и в качестве дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, на протяжении  20 лет занимается полеводством  и животноводством, начав этот бизнес с покупки дойной коровы. Благодаря упорному труду Чынаркул в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется 2 дойные коровы с приплодом, 10 голов мелкого рогатого скота, 2 лошади, ежемесячная прибыль от хозяйства составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). 
Так как осенний период является особенно активным, что связано с сезонностью в агросекторе, Чынаркул также как и многие жители сел нуждается в финансовой поддержке для     развития своего бизнеса. В связи с этим, Чынаркул обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота для откорма.  Доходы от кредита Чынаркул планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса.
texts.en:
Chynarkul is 50 years old. Alone, she has raised 4 children. Chynarkul works as a teacher of the Kyrgyz language in the school of the Bokombaevo village. As a source of additional income for her family, she has also been growing crops and raising livestock for the past 20 years, having started her business with a purchase of a dairy cow. Thanks to Chynarkul's hard work, her herd currently includes 2 dairy cows with offspring, 10 goats and sheep, and 2 horses, while the business' monthly income amounts to roughly 10,000 som (KGS).

As the autumn season is particularly busy in agriculture, Chynarkul, like many other farmers, needs financial support in order to develop her business. In light of this, Chynarkul has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 80,000 som (KGS) to purchase livestock for fattening. She plans to invest her profits from this loan into further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Milena

texts.es:
Milena tiene 57 años, es un buena mujer, amable y emprendedora. Está casada con William, de 62 años, con quien tiene seis hijos que ya son mayores e independientes. Vive en su casa propia, a lado de su esposo, con quien trabaja mucho, pues desea ahorrar lo suficiente para tener una vejez tranquila.

Hace 20 años abrió su pequeña, pero muy surtida tienda de abarrotes en su misma vivienda. Está ubicado en una esquina muy concurrida del sector donde vive, por lo que tiene buenas ventas diarias. Sin embargo, al ver que había más espacio para poder ampliar su negocio, decidió empezar a vender balones de gas, ya que en la zona no había ningún comercio orientado a este rubro. Por otro lado, también tiene un taller de vulcanizado en el que tiene a dos mecánicos trabajando con su esposo. Le va muy bien, y sabe que lo que ha logrado lo hizo en base a esfuerzo y mucho sacrificio, ya que considera que el progreso no llega de la noche a la mañana sino como fruto del trabajo. Milena tiene aun muchas metas que cumplir para su futuro y no piensa en dejar de trabajar todavía. 

Este es su crédito número 17 con MFP y agradece a quienes le brindan la oportunidad para acceder a este crédito, con el que tiene la seguridad de continuar con su trabajo. Por otro lado, se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual, ya que no desea dejar una imagen negativa en los miembros de su grupo que se caracterizan por la puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos.

Con el monto solicitado, 500 soles, comprará productos (arroz, azúcar, huevos, leche y embutidos) para surtir su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Milena, 57, is an outstanding, friendly, and enterprising woman. She is married to William, 62, with whom she has six grown and independent children. They live in their own house and work together so they can save enough to live comfortably in their senior years. Twenty years ago, Milena opened a small, but well-stocked, grocery store in her home, which is located on a busy corner and generates good sales. However, realizing that there was space to expand, she began selling propane gas because no other local business offered it. She also has a rubber workshop where two mechanics work with her husband. She knows that the business has prospered because of the effort and sacrifice they have put into it and that progress isn't made overnight, but rather is the fruit of hard work. Milena still has many goals to achieve and isn't thinking of retiring yet.

This is her 17th loan cycle with MFP, and she thanks those who offer her access to this loan, which will give her the security to keep working. She once again promises to make her payments on time because she doesn't want to leave a bad impression of her group members, who are responsible and punctual with their payments. With the loan of 500 soles, she will buy products (rice, sugar, eggs, milk, and canned goods) to stock her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy products (rice, sugar, eggs, milk, and canned goods) to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Rina

texts.es:
Rina tiene 39 años, es madre de Jamin, de 13 años, a quien cría y educa sola desde hace ya varios años. Vive en casa de su madre, a lado de ella, y trabaja mucho para poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.

Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de productos regionales. Desde muy temprano se dirige al puerto principal de la ciudad en busca de pescado seco, maíz, arroz, frijoles y todo lo que considere comercial, luego lo envía en grandes cantidades a las ciudades de la sierra para su comercialización. Lleva realizando este trabajo por 3 años y durante este tiempo aprendió muchas cosas, ya que las experiencias que ha tenido le enseñaron a ser más cuidadosa con algunos productos y a saber invertir en unos más que en otros. Espera seguir trabajando mucho, ya que su máximo anhelo es poder brindar una profesión a su hija, además desea tener un almacén en la ciudad donde pueda comprar y vender productos al por mayor. 

Este es su crédito número 6 con MFP, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su acceso a este financiamiento, ya que así se sentirá más segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Por otro lado, se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de forma puntual, del mismo modo se siente muy tranquila y respaldada por los integrantes de su banco comunal.

Con el monto solicitado, 1800 soles, comprará maíz y frijoles en sacos, al por mayor, para enviarlos a otras ciudades.
texts.en:
Rina, 39, is the mother of Jamin, 13, who she’s been raising and educating by herself for several years now.  She lives in her mother’s house with her and works very hard to be able to provide them with a better quality of life.

She buys and sells regional products.  She heads out to the city’s main port very early looking for dry fish, corn, rice, beans and anything else she considers commercial.  She then ships it in large amounts to cities in the mountains to be sold.  She’s been doing this work for three years now and has learned many things in this time.  Experiences she’s had have taught her to be more careful with some of the products and has learned to invest in some more than others.  She hopes to continue working much because her greatest hope is to provide her daughter with a profession.  She’d also like to have a warehouse in the city where she can buy and sell products at wholesale.

This is MFP loan #6 and she thanks those who make it possible for her to access financing because she will feel more confident about advancing in her work. On the other hand, she commits to make her payments punctually.  She also feels very comfortable and backed up by her fellow communal bank members.

She will use the requested 1800 soles to buy corn and beans in sacks and at wholesale to ship to other cities.

loans.use: to buy sacks of corn and beans at wholesale.

loans.name: Salonga

texts.en:
Salonga is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. He is married and has five children who are all currently in school. For the past three years, Salonga has been working hard to manage his boutique where he sells clothes. 

To help expand his business, Salonga has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy a wider variety of clothes, and will help Salonga to generate greater profits and allow him to buy a wide range of clothes to grow his business. Salonga hopes that in the future he will be able to sell a higher volume of clothing. 

Salonga is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Salonga who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy a wider variety of clothes for sale

loans.name: Firuz

texts.ru: Фируз проживает в городе Вахдат. Ему 27 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей. Фируз живет с родителями. Жена Фируза занимается домашним хозяйством. Его брат занимается своим бизнесом. Сам Фируз вместе с матерью занимается торговлей ковров. Торговлей он занимается уже пять лет. Фируз просит кредит для приобретения новых видов ковров.
texts.en: Firuz lives in the city of Vahdat. He is 27 years old, married, and has three children. Firuz lives in his parents' home, where his wife takes care of the household. His brother runs his own business, while Firuz and his mother sell carpets. Firuz has been engaged in trade for the past five years. He is requesting this loan to purchase new kinds of carpets.

loans.use: to purchase new kinds of carpets for sale

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 24 años, es una joven mujer, muy amable. Su pareja es Estalin, de 27 años, con quien tiene un pequeño hijo llamado Víctor de 4 años. 
Ella se dedica a la venta de comida. Su horario de atención se inicia al comenzar la noche y vende en una esquina de su barrio, donde acondiciona una mesa, una cocina artesanal y las sillas en las que atiende con mucho agrado a sus comensales. Lleva en este negocio cerca de un año y medio y lo hace con ayuda de su hermana y su pareja. Adicionalmente, vende ropa femenina desde hace un año, compra su mercadería de manera quincenal o mensual, principalmente ofrece lencería, ya que le permite tener más ganancias. Ambas actividades le ha permitido incrementar sus ingresos y obtener nuevos clientes. Le agrada mucho su negocio, pues no le demanda mucho esfuerzo y le permite dedicarle a su hijo el tiempo suficiente para atenderlo, además vende mucho, ya que sus clientes saben de su buena sazón, tiene muchos clientes que son muy exigentes y es por eso que ella siempre se esfuerza en comprar los mejores insumos para que sus comidas tengan siempre un exquisito sabor. 

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por ello se siente agradecida con las personas que le brindan el financiamiento que necesita para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado, se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual y espera continuar trabajando con su banco comunal por el compañerismo y la solidaridad que muestran entre ellos cada uno de sus integrantes.
Con el monto solicitado, 600 soles, comprará productos al por mayor como arroz, azúcar, tubérculos, carne de cerdo, de pollo, condimentos y otros insumos para continuar preparando sus comidas.
texts.en:
Rosa, 24, is a very kind young woman.   Her spouse is Estalin, 27, and they have a 4-year-old son named Víctor.  She sells food.  Her work schedule starts at night and she sells on a corner in her neighborhood where she sets up a table, an artisanal stove and chairs where she tends to her customers very happily.  She’s been in this business for a year and a half and her sister and spouse help her with it.  

She has also been selling women’s clothing, primarily lingerie, for a year.  She buys her merchandise either monthly or biweekly and earns more profits this way.  Both activities have allowed her to increase her income and to obtain new customers.  She likes her business very much for it demands little effort and lets her have time to dedicate to her son.  In addition, she sells a lot because her customers know that she cooks tasty food.  She has many demanding customers so she always strives to buy the best ingredients so that her food will always have exquisite taste.

This is her second MFP loan and she is grateful to the people who provide financing she needs to make her plans a reality.  She also commits to make her payments punctually and hopes to continue working with her communal bank because of the mutual support and companionship each of the members has.

She will use the requested 600 soles to buy products like rice, sugar, tubers, pork, chicken, condiments and other ingredients at wholesale to continue preparing her dishes.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Gulmairam

texts.ru:
Гулмайрам 49 лет, замужем, воспитала 4 детей. Гулмайрам в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, на протяжении  20 лет занимается полеводством  и животноводством, начав этот бизнес с 15,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Гулмайрам в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется 3 бычка, 20 голов мелкого рогатого скота, 1 лошадь, ежемесячная прибыль от хозяйства составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). Также, Гулмайрам обрабатывает 30 соток земли с кукурузой, прибыль с продажи которой является сезонной. 
Так как осенний период является особенно активным, что связано с сезонностью в агросекторе, Гулмайрам также, как и многие жители сел нуждается в финансовой поддержке для развития своего бизнеса. В связи с этим, Гулмайрам обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дойных коров.  Доходы от кредита Гулмайрам планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса, а в доме сделать косметический ремонт.
texts.en:
Gulmairam is 49 years old, married, and has raised 4 children. As the main source of income for her family, Gulmairam has been raising livestock and growing crops for the past 20 years, having started her business with 15,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, Gulmairam's herd presently includes 3 calves, 20 sheep and goats, and 1 horse, and the business earns roughly 10,000 som (KGS) per month. Additionally, Gulmairam works 0.3 hectares of land with corn, whose sale brings seasonal profits.

As the autumn period is particularly busy in agriculture, Gulmairam, as many other farmers, needs financial support in order to develop her business. In light of this, Gulmairam has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase dairy cows. She plans to invest her profits from this loan into further expansion of her business, and also to update the decor in her home.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cows

loans.name: Magda

texts.es:
Magda tiene 64 años, es una mujer valiente que no dudo ningún momento en trabajar mucho por sus hijos cuando quedó viuda. Lamentablemente en la vida las cosas no le fueron muy bien, ya que al poco tiempo de perder a su esposo también perdió a un hijo, quien dejó huérfanos a tres niños a quienes ella cría como si fueran sus propios hijos, Luis de 15, Mirela de 13 y Carla de 11 años. 

Cada día, desde muy temprano, ella sale al mercado en busca de prendas de vestir de segundo uso, las comprar por fardos y al por mayor, una vez que tiene la ropa se dirige hacia los pueblos más alejados de la ciudad, trasladándose en un bote o en taxi, dependiendo del lugar. Normalmente vende las prendas, pero en algunos casos las intercambia con otras cosas, como gallinas de chacra, carne de monte o distintas frutas que posteriormente vende en la ciudad. Lleva realizando este trabajo por 30 años y fue lo que le permitió educar y criar a sus hijos y ahora a sus nietos, siempre trabajó sola y los hace así hasta ahora. 

Este es su crédito número 9 con MFP, es por eso que agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible su crédito para continuar realizando su trabajo con mejores resultados. Por otro lado, se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas como lo hizo en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Y le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos los integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias.

Con el monto solicitado, 1500 soles, comprará ropa nueva y ropa usada para continuar vendiendo en los pueblos aledaños. Asimismo complementará su mercadería comprando golosinas y algunos abarrotes que le solicitan sus clientes.
texts.en:
Magda is 64 years old. She is a courageous woman who did not hesitate for a minute in working a lot for her children when she became a widow. Sadly, things did not go very well for her in life, since not long after losing her husband, she also lost a son. He left three orphaned children that she cares for as if they were her own children, Luis, 15, Mirela, 13, and Carla, 11.

Every day, very early, she goes to the market in search of second-hand clothing. She buys them in bundles or wholesale. Once she has the clothes, she heads towards the city's outlying villages, going by boat or taxi depending on the place. Normally she sells the clothes, but in some cases, she exchanges them for other things like farm hens, hunted meat, or different fruits that she later sells in the city. She has been doing this work for 30 years and this is what allowed her to educate and raise her children and now her grandchildren. She always worked alone and she has done it this way up until now.

This is her ninth credit with MPF. That is why she is grateful to all the people who make her loan possible so she can continue doing her work with better results. She promises, once again, to make her payments on time like she did with her previous loans. She is pleased to be part of her communal bank because all the members are responsible and very supportive people.

With the asked-for sum, 1500 soles, she will buy new and used clothing to continue selling in outlying towns. She will also add to her merchandise, purchasing sweets and groceries that her customers ask for.

loans.use: to buy new and used clothing to continue selling in the neighboring towns, and also to add to her merchandise, buying sweets and groceries that her customers ask for.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 59 años, es una mujer amable y muy trabajadora. Su pareja desde hace 47 años, su fiel compañero es Hugo, y con quien tuvo siete hijos. Actualmente viven con dos de sus hijos, en la casa que compraron, en conjunto, ahorrando de las ganancias que cada uno conseguía como fruto de su trabajo. 

Su negocio es la venta de comida. A diario prepara desayunos y almuerzos, trabaja con la ayuda de su esposo, quien se encarga de la atención durante las mañanas, mientras que ella se dirige al mercado comprar todo lo necesario para la preparación de los platillos del día siguiente, y a su retorno ayuda también con la atención al público. Su puesto está ubicado cerca de su casa, frente a un hospital y a un parque, lo cual es una gran ventaja. Lleva en este rubro más de 21 años y lo complementa con la venta de golosinas y frutas. Este trabajo le gusta mucho debido a que le genera buenas ganancias, pero también sabe que su clientela exige mucho en cuanto a sabor y comodidad, es por eso que desea comprar los principales ingredientes que usa en su trabajo al por mayor para tenerlos siempre disponibles y una mesa amplia y de buena calidad para brindar una mejor atención.

Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su acceso a este crédito para continuar con el logro de sus objetivos. Por otro lado, se compromete a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos los integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias.

Con el monto solicitado, 500 soles, comprará arroz, aceite, azúcar y otros productos que usa continuamente en su labor. Comprará también una mesa de mejor calidad para que sus clientes se sientan más cómodos.
texts.en:
Rosa, 59, is a kind, very hardworking woman.  Her spouse for the last 47 years has been her faithful companion, Hugo; she had 7 children with him.  She currently lives with two of her children in the house they bought together using savings each one got from the fruits of their labor.

Her business is selling food.  She prepares breakfasts and lunches every day.  Her husband helps her with the work.  He tends to customers in the morning while she heads out to the market to buy everything needed for the next day’s meals.  When she returns she helps take care of customers too.  

Her stand is located near her house across from a hospital and a park which is a big advantage.  She’s been in this line of work for more than 21 years and she complements it with fruit and snack sales.  She likes the work very much because it generates good profits but she also knows that her customers demand much with respect to flavor and comfort which is why she wants to buy the main ingredients she uses in her work at wholesale so that they will be on hand always and a spacious, good-quality table to provide better customer service.

This is her first MFP loan and she thanks those who make access to credit possible to continue towards reaching her objectives.  She commits to make her payments punctually and she enjoys being part of her communal bank because all the members are responsible, very supportive people.

She will use the requested 500 soles to buy rice, oil, sugar and other products she uses constantly in her work.  She will also buy a better quality table that her customers can sit at more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and a better quality table.

loans.name: Benito

texts.es:
El sr. Benito esta casado, tiene hijos ya mayores y tiene una despensa y bodega.
El tiene una clientela bien formada para la cual quiere seguir trabajando es por eso que quiere surtir aún más su negocio y así prestar un mayor servicio a sus clientes.
Solicita el crédito para comprar carnes, huevos, aceites, arroz bebidas como gaseosas y cervezas.
texts.en: Benito is married with grown children and has a small food and grocery store. He has a good customer base so he wants to continue working. This is why he wants to stock his business even more and that way provide better service to his customers. He is asking for the loan to buy meats, eggs, oils, rice, and drinks like soft drinks and beers.

loans.use: to buy rice, eggs, oils, meat, soft drinks, and beer.

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.es:
La señora Ignacia es una persona que quiere salir adelante es por eso que se acercó a la Fundación a solicitar el crédito para poder surtir aún mas su negocio de venta de comidas y gaseosas.
Ignacia trabaja hace 15 años en su negocio, esta casada y sus hijos ya estan grande y con familia, ella igualmente procura salir adelante para tener una vida mejor.
Solicita el crédito para comprar productos para elaborar sus alimentos, productos como: arroz, leches, carnes, huevos, gaseosas, y así satisfacer aún mas a su clientela.
texts.en: Ignacia is a person who very much wants to get ahead which is why she approached the Fundación to request a loan to stock her soft-drink and food sales business still more.  Ignacia has worked in her business for 15 years.  She’s married and her children are all adults with families of their own.  She tries to get ahead to have a better life.  She’s asking for the loan to buy products such as rice, dairy products, meat, eggs, and soft drinks used in her food preparation to better satisfy customers.

loans.use: to buy oil, rice, dairy products, meat, eggs and soft-drinks.

loans.name: Bertalina

texts.es: Doña Bertalina tiene 44 años de edad, es casada y no tiene hijos, su esposo vive en Estados Unidos, ella trabajaba en una tienda de venta de ropa y después de un tiempo decidió independizarse  y desde hace 8 años inicio su negocio de venta de abarrotería en general y venta de telas, trabaja de lunes a sábado, el negocio lo atiende sola y su horario de atención inicia desde las 8:00 am y culmina a las 6:00 pm. El préstamo que doña Bertalina solicita lo invertirá en la compra de arroz, azúcar, frijoles, dulces, embutidos, lácteos, detergentes, aceite vegetal, entre otros, también comprara telas de muchas variedades, con la inversión en su negocio piensa incrementar sus ventas y con eso mejorar sus utilidades. El único desafío es la competencia ya que su negocio se encuentra ubicado en el centro de la ciudad y cerca tiene un supermercado. Su meta es que su negocio crezca. Es su primer crédito en FAMA y espera cancelar sus cuotas de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Bertalina, 44, is married and has no children; her husband lives in the United States.  She used to work in a clothing store and after some time decided to become independent and 8 years ago started her own grocery and fabric store.  She works Monday through Saturday by herself and is open for business from 8am until 6pm.  

Bertalina will use the loan she’s requesting to buy rice, sugar, beans, candy, canned goods, dairy products, detergent, vegetable oil, among other; she will also buy assorted fabric.  With this investment in her business she intends to increase sales and improve profits.  

Her only challenge is competition since her business is located downtown and she has a large supermarket nearby.  Her goal is that her business grows.  This is her first FAMA loan and she expects to make her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy groceries in general and fabric.
