Ирине необходимы дополнительные средства в размере 5 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить товар к школьному сезону. Имея огромный опыт работы с данной группой товаров и желание вкладывать в свое дело, Ирина надеется и дальше развивать свой бизнес, обеспечивая свою семью всем необходимым.
texts.en: Irina lives and works in Melitopol.  She sells children's clothing and shoes at one of the local city markets.  Dresses, cardigans, blouses and shoes are among Irina's most popular merchandise now.  She has her own retail outlet, and her work experience is about 16 years.  Irina needs additional money in the amount of 5,000 hryvnia to purchase merchandise for the school season.  Having extensive work experience with this merchandise group and a desire to invest in her business, Irina hopes to continue developing her business and provide everything necessary for her family.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for the school season

loans.name: Elkin Jaime

texts.es:
Elkin trabajó durante 14 años en una finca donde realizaba las labores de mantenimiento de la misma y desde hace 4 años buscando tener mejores condiciones económicas, decidió montar su propio negocio donde presta el servicio de arreglo y mantenimiento de jardines. Gracias a este negocio ha logrado salir adelante y brindarles a su esposa y sus 5 hijos una mejor calidad de vida en su hogar, y debido a que los 5 hijos aún se encuentran estudiando, ha logrado ofrecerles el acceso a una educación de mejor calidad. Su negocio ha venido creciendo mucho y esto ha hecho que su principal herramienta de averiara, y ya que no cuenta con un capital suficiente para su arreglo, Elkin busca un préstamo para reparar su guadañadora y continuar generando los ingresos que requiere en su hogar.

Su sueño es poder tener un gran negocio donde pueda generar empleo para las personas más necesitadas de su municipio y también espera que sus hijos pueda seguir teniendo una buena calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Elkin worked doing maintenance on a farm for 14 years.  Four years ago, when he was looking for better financial conditions, he decided to establish his own business of garden maintenance and care services.  Thanks to this business he has managed to get ahead and to give his wife and five children a better quality of life in their home.  Because his five children are still in school, he has managed to give them access to a better quality education.  

His business has been growing a lot, and this has caused damage to his primary tool.  He does not have enough capital to fix it.  Elkin is looking for a loan to repair his hay mower and to continue generating the income his household needs.

His dream is to be able to have a large business where he is able to generate employment for the people most in need in his municipality.  He also hopes that his children are able to continue having a good quality of life.

loans.use: to repair his hay mower and continue generating the income his household needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a stainless steel table which he will use to provide better conditions for food preparation.

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es: Maria tiene 34 años y trabaja en el negocio familiar el cual inicio junto a su esposo, empezó con una tienda pequeña gracias a un capital invertido el cual creció poco a poco, con ese aumento comenzó a invertir en ropa la cual compraba y vendía por pedido convirtiendo su tienda en un bazar donde se podía encontrar diversidad de productos hasta bisutería. Hoy en día alquila un local en donde hace poco tiempo abrió un cyber con 4 computadoras brindando el servicio de internet y copias. En su hogar todos están involucrados en el negocio por lo que cada uno de sus miembros se dedican a una actividad en concreto siendo ella la administradora. El préstamo que ella está solicitando es para la compra de computadoras con las cuales aumentara la capacidad de servicio para sus clientes. Espera continuar con el negocio pagando puntualmente sus cuotas ya que su sueño es poder abrir su negocio pero en un local propio ya que el actual es alquilado.
texts.en: Maria is thirty-four years old and works in the family business she started with her husband. She began with a small store thanks to the capital she invested, which grew slowly. With the increase she began to invest in clothing which she purchased and sold based on orders. She converted her store into a bazaar where she offered a wide range of products, even imitation jewelry. Today, she rents a space where she recently opened a cyber cafe with four computers, offering Internet service as well as photocopying. Everyone in her home is involved with the business, so that each one has a specific task and she is the administrator. She is requesting a loan to purchase computers, which will increase the service capacity she can offer her customers. She hopes to continue with her business by making her loan payments on time. Her dream is to be able to open her business in a space she owns since she is currently renting space.

loans.use: to purchase computers.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de elaboracion de quesos,la socia tambien se dedica al negocio de crianza de vacas,los quesos la socia loa vende en las diferentes ferias que existe en el distrito de Anta y las vacas tambien los vende en las ferias,la socia ya tiene 8 años en estos negocios,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los quesos.La socia solicita el credito para comprar leche y sal para la elaboracion de quesos.
La socia en la foto esta cocinando una carne frita porque los dias de su reunion se cocinaron para que los socios compartan un momento agradable.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower still has her cheese-making business. She also raises cows. The borrower sells the cheeses in the various markets in Anta district, and also sells the cows in the markets. 

She already has eight years in these businesses. Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell the cheeses. The borrower is requesting the loan in order to buy milk and salt for making cheeses.

In the photo, the borrower is cooking fried meat; because on the days they meet, the group members cook, so that they can share a pleasant time. 

The borrower is happy about the loan and promises to make her installment payments.

loans.use: To buy milk and salt for making cheeses.

loans.name: Unidos Para El Futuro 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Yrene is a member of a loan group called Unidos para el Futuro (United for the Future) 1, 2 & 3. Its members live in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo, where running water is non-potable and electricity is unreliable. Yrene is excited to be taking out her ninth loan in four years from Esperanza. With these loans she was able to start her business.

One of the most important products for the day's main meal is the rice. Yrene went into business buying rice wholesale and selling it in small bags, sometimes on credit. She uses her profits to reinvest in her business. 

She lives with her long-term partner and their three children in a very simple home in one of the poorest neighborhoods in their area. Despite her poverty, she is determined to care for her children and pay for the cost of their education. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice.

loans.name: Sagyn

texts.ru:
Сагын 41 год, одна воспитывает 4 детей школьного возраста, 3 старших живут отдельно. Сагын в качестве источника дохода для своей семьи, на протяжении 5 лет занимается полеводством  и животноводством, начав этот бизнес с 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Сагын в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется дойная корова с приплодом, 10 голов мелкого рогатого скота, 1 лошадь, ежемесячная прибыль от хозяйства составляет около 5,000 сом (KGS). Также, Сагын обрабатывает 9 га земли с многолетними травами, служащей в качестве корма для скота. 
Так как осенний период является особенно активным, что связано с сезонностью в агросекторе, Сагын также, как и многие жители сел, нуждается в финансовой поддержке для развития своего бизнеса. В связи с этим, Сагын обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дойных коров.  Доходы от кредита Сагын планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса, а на следующий год помочь сыну в проведении свадьбы.
texts.en: Sagyn is 41 years old and raising four school-age children by herself, and her three oldest live separately.  To provide a source of income for her family, she has been involved in farming and animal husbandry for five years, having started this business with 5,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to Sagyn's hard work, today her business contains one dairy cow with offspring, ten small livestock and one horse, and the monthly profit from the business amounts to about 5,000 som (KGS).  She also works on 9 hectares of land, where she grows perennial herbs, which serve as livestock feed.  Because the fall season is especially active, which has to do with seasonality of the agricultural sphere, Sagyn, just like many other village residents, needs financial support to develop her business.  Due to this, Sagyn requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy dairy cows.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a continued business development and wants to help her son to hold a wedding next year.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cows

loans.name: Ismonali

texts.ru: Исмонали житель города Вахдат. Ему 26 лет. Он женат. Исмонали живет вместе с родителями. Он предоставляет услугу.	Он уже два года как работает таксистом. Исмонали просит кредит для ремонта автомобиля.
texts.en: Ismonali is a resident of the city of Vahdat.  He is 26 years old, married and lives together with his parents.  He provides a service.  He has been working as a taxi driver for two years.  Ismonali is requesting this loan to repair his car.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Orlando De Jesus

texts.es:
Orlando se encuentra casado y tiene 3 hijos a quienes les brinda una educación de buena calidad gracias a su negocio de cría de cerdos con el que ha logrado brindarle a su familia una calidad de vida digna. Desde hace unos 4 años comenzó con la actividad debido a que antes trabajaba en un lugar donde por circunstancias ajenas a su voluntad tuvo que abandonar, y encontró en la actividad de cría de cerdos la oportunidad de seguir generando los ingresos que requiere para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar. Gracias a que tiene muy buenos pedidos por parte de sus clientes, Orlando busca un préstamo para comprar el cuido que necesita para engordar las crías del cerdo que está en gestación.

Su mayor sueño es seguir teniendo este negocio que le ha permitido superar las grandes dificultades económicas por las que estaba atravesando su familia hace unos años y así poder seguir progresando para que todos puedan tener una buena calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Orlando is married and has three children, who he is able to provide with a good quality education thanks to his business raising pigs. Through his business, he has managed to provide his family with a respectable life. He began his business four years ago because he had previously worked in a place he had to leave due to circumstances beyond his control. He found the opportunity to continue generating the income necessary to maintain his living expenses by raising pigs. Thanks to the many orders his customers have made, Orlando is requesting a loan to purchase the feed he needs to fatten up his pregnant pigs.

His biggest dream is to continue having this business which has allowed him to overcome the great economic difficulties that his family was experiencing several years ago, and in that way be able to continue getting ahead so that they can all have a good quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase the feed he needs to fatten up his pregnant pigs.

loans.name: Encarnacion

texts.es:
La socia Encarnación tiene 56 años de edad, es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene 8 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias del hogar con el negocio de elaboración, compra y venta de artesanía especialmente chompas de alpaca, la socia desde hace varios años que se dedica a este trabajo y le va muy bien, la socia es una persona carismática y con muchas ganas de salir adelante por su familia.

La socia Encarnación solicita el préstamo para la comprar materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo lana de alpaca y está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.

La socia Encarnación sigue participando al banco comunal” COMUZONE III”. Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días en el distrito de Cusco de la provincia de Cusco y del departamento de Cusco.
texts.en:
Encarnación is 56, married, and has eight children. She alternates her daily household activities with her business making, buying and selling handicrafts, especially alpaca sweaters. She has been doing this work for several years, and it is going very well. 

The borrower is a charming person, with a strong desire to succeed for her family's sake.

Encarnación is requesting the loan to buy work materials such as alpaca wool. She is happy about the loan and promises to make her installment payments. 

Encarnación is still participating in the ”Comuzone lll" communal bank. The communal bank meets once a month in Cusco district in Cusco province,  Cusco department.

loans.use: To buy work materials such as alpaca wool.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph lives in the Mariakani area of Coast province, Kenya. He is married and has four children. He owns a video cafe, a business he has been operating for seven months now.

He learned about Milango through a friend who invited him to the group, and he joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve on his business operations. His main challenges are finding customers, and also fuel prices and purchasing stock.

Joseph is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to refurbish his video show room. His extra income will be added to his savings to start a poultry farm. He aspires to own other video shows in other places.

loans.use: to refurbish his video show room.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes,la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar,leche y galletas,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio,en sus tiempos libres a la socia le gusta preparar tortas,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar leche,azucar,arroz y galletas al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower still has her grocery store business. She sells basic household necessities such as rice, sugar, milk and cookies. She works from 8:00 a.m to 6:00 p.m. She already has seven years in this business.

In her free time, the borrower likes to make cakes. Her dream is to expand her grocery store business. She is applying for the loan in order to buy milk, sugar, rice and cookies, at wholesale. 

The borrower is happy about the loan, and promises to make her installment payments.

loans.use: To buy milk, sugar, rice and cookies at wholesale.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es: Juan  José de 54 años de edad,  casado, con 2 hijos menores de edad , tiene por actividad económica la venta de queso, a la cual se  dedica desde hace 4 años, lo inicio con ayuda de un hermano dinero que la esposa le mandaba porque se fue a trabajar fuera del país debido a la crisis económica por la cual estábamos atravesando, el queso lo distribuyo de forma ambulante a  pulpería de la localidad y comerciantes del mercador que son  clientes fijos y eventuales, como toda  persona me he propuesto metas y objetivos como son terminar de formar a mis hijos ya que están estudiando, terminar de hacerle las mejoras a mi casa. El financiamiento lo necesito para comprar el distinto tipo de queso  y satisfacer la demanda de mis clientes como: queso ahumado, asado, de crema, fresco, seco, mantequillas, queso de quesillos, cuajadas, entre otros.
texts.en:
Juan José, 54 years old, married, with two children who are minors, has a business selling cheese, in which he has made a living for four years.  He began with the help of a brother and money that his wife sent to him because she left to work outside of the country due to the economic crisis that they were going through.  The cheese he distributes as a traveling vendor to a local store in town and to the market merchants that are his regular and prospective customers.  Like others, he has put forward goals and objectives such as to finish educating his children as they are students and to finish making improvements to his house.  

He needs the financing in order to buy the different types of cheeses to satisfy the demands of his clients, such as:  smoked cheeses, roasted cheeses, cream cheeses, fresh (soft) cheeses, hard (aged) cheeses, butters, cheese for 'quesillos' (a tortilla filled with a type of soft cheese) and curds, among others.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of cheeses.

loans.name: Elvia Margarita

texts.es: Doña Elvia tiene 37 años de edad, su familia esta integrada por su esposo que se dedica a la agricultura y ganaderia, y sus tres hijos de los cuales dos son mujeres. Ella es una persona muy simpatica y muy orgullosa de sus tres hijos porque son muy buenas personas y muy buenos estudiantes. Elvia inició con su pequeña pulperia en el 2005, la cual atiende desde las 7:00 am hasta la tarde-noche. Su mayor ventaja es que no hay mas pulperias en la comunidad y sus vecinos realizan las compras diarias en su negocio, aunque ultimamente sus ventas han bajado ya que cada dia los productos de la canasta basica son mas caros. El prestamo que Doña Elvia solicita lo necesita para la compra de arroz, manteca, embutidos, lacteos, refrescos, azucar, frijoles, dulces, pan, churros, entre otros. Con el apoyo del prestamo podra surtir de mas y variados productos y con ello sus clientes siempre encontraron lo que necesitan. Su meta es apoyar a sus hijos con el estudio, aunque siente un poco de temor de que al graduarse no encuentren un empleo, asi que espera que ellos se decidan a tener un negocio propio al igual que ella. Este es el segundo ciclo de Doña Elvia en FAMA y ha cumplido de manera puntual el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Elvia, 27, has a family composed of her husband who works in agriculture and animal husbandry and their three children two of which are girls.  She is a very likeable person who is very proud of her three children because they are very good people and very good students.

Elvia opened a small grocery store in 2005 that she tends to from 7am until the early evening.  Her greatest advantage is that there are no other grocery stores in the community and her neighbors make daily purchases in her store although sales have dropped lately because basic staples are getting more and more expensive every day.

The loan Elvia is asking for is needed to buy rice, lard, canned goods, dairy products, soft-drinks, sugar, beans, candy, bread and snacks, among others.  With support from the loan she will be able to stock more varied products so that her customers will always be able to find what they need.

Her goal is to support her children’s schooling although she does fear that when they graduate they will be unable to find jobs so she hopes they will opt to have businesses of their own like she has.  This is Elvia’s second cycle in FAMA and she’s made her installment payments punctually.

loans.use: to purchase groceries in general

loans.name: Yhury

texts.es:
Yhury nació en la ciudad del Cusco y tiene 37 años de edad. Actualmente, Yhury vive en la ciudad imperial de los Incas (Cusco), él  antes tenía dos hijos pero ahora tiene tres hijos y se siente muy feliz, él es un hombre trabajador y responsable que se dedica a la venta de bebidas alcohólicas pues sigue teniendo  un pequeño depósito de cerveza y vende las 24 horas del día. Ya son varios  años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Yhury requiere el préstamo para comprar más cerveza. 

Yhury es una persona responsable que sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “Comuzone III” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en:
Yhury was born in the city of Cuzco and is 37 years old. Currently, Yhury lives in Cusco, the Imperial City of the Incas. Before, he had two children, but now he has three children, and feels very happy. 

He is a hard-working and responsible man, who sells alcoholic beverages. He continues to have a small beer store, and sells 24 hours a day. He has been working in this business for several years now, and it is going very well. On this occasion, Yhury needs the loan to buy more beer. 

Yhury is a responsible person, who still belongs to the “Comuzone III” communal bank of Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: To buy more beer.

loans.name: Marelis

texts.es: Marelis compró materias primas como telas para uniformes escolares y accesorios varios para vender en su negocio como comerciante y logró vender toda su inversión. Ella se siente muy contenta pues gracias a los finaciamientos de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y Kiva ha logrado organizar su taller, tener un mayor número de maquinarias y trabajar mucho mas holgada con el dinero. En la actualidad se dispone a recibir un nuevo credikiva con el cual comprará telas por mayor volumen y en diferentes especificaciones, para tener existencia y diseñar vestidos de acuerdo a la temporada que se avecina, obteniendo precios en descuentos que trasladará a las  utilidades de su negocio y es en esto que radica el éxito de su credikiva.
texts.en: Marelis purchased raw materials such as cloth for school uniforms and various accessories to sell in her business as a merchant, and she managed to sell her entire investment. She is very happy since thanks to the financing from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and Kiva she has managed to organize her workshop, have a larger number of machines, and work much more comfortably. Currently, she is preparing to receive a new Kiva loan which she will use to purchase cloth in wholesale quantities and with different specifications so she can have stock and design dresses in accordance with the coming season. She will receive discount prices which she will transmit to her business’ profits, and in this way her Kiva loan will provide her with success.

loans.use: to purchase clothing in wholesale quantities.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina lives in Kongowea area of Coast province, Kenya. She is married and has four children, of whom one attends school. 

She owns a food cafe, a business she has been operating for four years. Apart from this, she owns rental houses where she gets her salary.

Amina is applying for a loan of 31,500 Kenya shillings to purchase stocks of food, e.g., fat, sugar, flour. 

She learned about Milango through a friend who invited her to the group.  She joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. The challenge she is facing is bad debts from customers due to late payments.

The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve the living standard of her family. Her plan for the future is to own a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of food, e.g., fat, sugar, and flour, for her cafe.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is a food café owner and lives in the Coastal town of Malindi, Kenya. She is married and has two children in school. 

She started the business from her personal savings. The business has been running for two years. The area has a high number of residents due to the low cost housing, and this makes such business quite a profitable venture. She employs two other people.

She was introduced to Milango by a friend.  She is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to purchase additional stock, e.g., sugar, beans, flour, cooking oil, and charcoal.   The business has faced the challenges of price fluctuations and the high cost of materials.  Sophia would like to maximize her sales. 

Her ambition is to make the café become a world-class hotel and confectionery shop in the near future.  She believes the additional income from this loan will help improve her family’s living standard and provide education to her children.

loans.use: To buy additional stock, e.g., sugar, beans, flour, and cooking oil, for her cafe.

loans.name: Vule

texts.en:
Vule is an Egyptian woman living in a major city in central Albania, where there are 80,000 members of this vulnerable ethnic minority community.  She is 57 years old.

Her children are all grown now.   She receives no financial support from them because “they simply don’t have anything to offer me,” Vule said. She and her husband receive disability income, “yet it is impossible to live on it,” she continued. 

For the past ten years, she has been selling used clothes and shoes and earned enough to feed herself.  Now she wants to purchase more used items to increase sales and profits, in order to cover medical expenses. 

This loan will be a great help to Vule and her husband.  She is thankful to Kiva and VisionFund Albania staff for reaching out to the most vulnerable, like herself.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Donwahoué Marcel

texts.fr: Donwahoué Marcel est âgé de 37 ans et vit au Bénin. Donwahoué Marcel n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Donwahoué Marcel est marié à une marchande du nom de Antoinette. Le couple a six enfants à leur charge, dont certains scolarisés. Parmi les enfants, il y a deux qui ne sont pas leurs propres enfants. Donwahoué Marcel vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec sa femme, les charges de la maison. Afin d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Donwahoué Marcel mène comme activité depuis une quinzaine d’année, la coiffure. De façon secondaire, Donwahoué Marcel vend de l’huile de palme dans une région du Bénin. Donwahoué Marcel s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Donwahoué Marcel sollicite pour la troisième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt lui permettra certainement de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
Donwahoué Marcel is 37 years old and lives in Benin.  He never attended school and is married to a seller named Antoinette.

Donwahoué Marcel and Antoinette have six children in their care, some of whom go to school.  Among the children, two are not their own children.

Donwahoué Marcel lives with his wife and children and takes care of the household expenses with his wife.  In order to ensure that the various family expenses are covered, he has been working as a hairdresser for about fifteen years.  Additionally, he also sells palm oil in one of the regions of Benin.  He buys his supplies in Benin.

In order to satisfy his customers' needs and to increase his turnover and income, Donwahoué Marcel is requesting a third loan from ALIDé.  This loan will surely allow him to raise the level of his activity and to increase his profits.

loans.use: to buy hair dressing supplies.

loans.name: Henry

texts.es: Henry de 48 años de edad habita con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos en las edades e 19 a 22 años, en el municipio de San Jacinto-Departamento de Bolívar, tierra de las artesanías, especialmente de hamacas en tejido vertical y de hermosas mochilas en hilo fino.Él continuando la tradición cultural, hace 2 años cuando sus hijos fueron a estudiar a la ciudad de Cartagena de Indias, aprovechó esa oportunidad para iniciar un negocio que apoyara los gastos adicionales de manutención y estadia en esta ciudad,; fue así como   teniéndolos a ellos  en Cartagena decidió comercializar  artesanías, como efectivamente lo hizo, apoyado por ellos; hoy  comercializa hamacas y mochilas a turistas, estudiantes y trabajadores independientes principalmente, a quienes vende sin intermediariarios.  Sus compras las realiza de contado en pequeños almacenes de la población, que adquieren estos productos directamente de las manos de las artesanas de la región. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que  hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará hamacas, bolsos, y artículos varios que han sido encargados, cuando realizó su tarea de preventa. Con su credikiva, Henry incrementará sus ventas y con ello sus ingresos, que son los principales recursos con los que cuenta para aumentar el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Henry is 48 years old. He lives with his partner and their three children, ages 19 to 22, in the municipality of San Jacinto, in Bolívar department. This is the land of crafts, especially hammocks woven on a vertical loom, and beautiful backpacks, woven with fine thread. 

Continuing the cultural tradition, two years ago, when his his children went to study in the city of Cartagena de Indias, he took advantage of that  opportunity to start a business to support the added expenses of meals and lodging in that city. This was how, having them in Cartagena, he decided to sell crafts, as indeed he did, with their help. 

Today he sells hammocks and bags, mainly to tourists, students and self-employed workers, to whom he sells without middlemen. 

He makes his purchases for cash in small stores in the town, that acquire these products directly from the hands of the artisans in the region. 

Currently, he is applying for a credikiva loan, his first from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which he will buy hammocks, bags and various craft items that have been ordered through his pre-sales work. 

With his credikiva, Henry will increase his sales and thereby his income, which is the main resource he has for improving his family's well-being.

loans.use: To buy hammocks, bags, and various craft items.

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es: Teodoro de 35 años de edad, vive en el municipio del Negrito, Yoro junto a su esposa y sus 3 hijos. El se ha dedicado a la ebanistería, pero hace 3 años estableció en su casa un negocio de venta de variedades, todo tipo de mercadería como ser: sandalias, fajas, CD,  floreros, ganchos, colas para cabello, productos plásticos, cargadores, controles, etc. el está solicitando un préstamo por 20,100 Lempiras para comprar ropa interior, sandalias, controles de Tv  y cargadores de celular, y otra achinería. El quiere tener surtido el negocio, pues comprando al por mayor se ahorra gastos de transporte. Su meta es tener siempre una fuente de ingresos para mantener a su familia y brindarles buena educación a  sus hijos.
texts.en: Teodoro, 35, lives in the municipality of Negrito in the department of Yoro with his wife and their 3 children.  He has worked as a cabinetmaker, but 3 years ago he started up a business selling general merchandise from his home.  He sells all types of merchandise, including: sandals, traditional woven belts, CDs, vases, decorative hair pins, pony-tail holders, plastic products, chargers, remote controls, etc.  He is requesting a loan for 20,100 Honduran lempiras to buy underwear, sandals, TV remotes, cellular phone chargers and other products.  He wants to stock up his store, and by purchasing at wholesale he saves on transportation costs.  His goal is to always have a source of income to support his family, and to provide a good education to his children.

loans.use: to buy underwear, sandals, hair accessories, CDs, TV remotes and chargers to stock up his store

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: La Sra. Olga  es casada y de 57 años, desde hace mas de 5 años vive en casa propi. Olga se dedica a la venta de abarrotes desde hace un año y medio, su esposo le ayuda a atender el negocio y juntos lo han sacado adelante gracias a su paciencia y manera de tratar a los clientes. Solicita un crédito para compra de mercancía para que su tienda siga en crecimiento y así poder brindar siempre a sus clientes lo mejor, además de tener más ingresos para poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Olga, 57 years old, is married and has lived in her own home for five years.  Olga has worked at her grocery store for a year and a half.  Her husband helps her at the store and together they have succeeded thanks to their patience and the way they treat their customers.  

She is asking for this loan to purchase merchandise so that her store can continue growing so that she can always provide her customers with the best, in addition to having more income to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Mujeres En Desarrollo 1 &7 Group

texts.en:
Marta is the coordinator of her group, "Mujeres en Desarrollo 1 & 7" (Women in Development). This group is located in the rural areas surrounding San Pedro, where running water (none of it potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her two children and her long-term partner.

Marta is excited to be taking her fifth loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown in her business and her loan amount. 

She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling fruits and vegetables.  She operates a fruit and vegetable stall, where she sells plantains, cassava, oranges, bananas, and other tropical products.  She will buy all of this products to increase her inventory. 

She will use the profits to invest in her family's expenses and to improve her living condition by saving; she plans to start building her house. 

She still dreams of having a successful business. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and fruits for her stall.

loans.name: Petra Graciela

texts.es: Petra tiene en playas un puesto de venta de corvinas el cual heredo de su padre, hace 25 años que tiene su negocio y le va bien sobre todo porque conoce del negocio y tiene muchos clientes fijos. La corvina es un producto muy apetecido ya que es el ingrediente principal para la elaboración del ceviche, cazuela, arroz con corvina etc., por lo que tiene gran demanda sobre todo los restaurant quienes lo ofrecen como un plato típico. Ella no tiene hijos menores ya que todos son mayores de edad, su ayudante diario es un nieto de 13 años quien está a su cargo y a quien le está enseñando el negocio. El préstamo que solicita es para comprar el producto y tener capital de trabajo ya que compra por gavetas para vender por unidad, espera a futuro seguir trabajando sin problemas y construir mejor su casa.
texts.en: Petra has a corvina sales stand in Playas that she inherited from her father. She has had the business for 25 years and it is going well for her above all because she knows the business and has a regular customer base. Corvina is a very sought-after product since it's a main ingredient in making ceviche, cazuela, rice with corvina, etc. For this reason, she has a lot of demand, above all from the restaurants that offer them as typical dishes. She doesn't have young children now that all of them are grown. Her daily helper is her 13-year-old grandchild who she takes care of and to whom she is teaching the business. The loan she is applying for is to buy product and have work capital because she buys by the crate and sells by the unit. She hopes in the future to keep working without problems and build her house better.

loans.use: to buy corvina

loans.name: Eliana Del Carmen

texts.es: Eliana de 31 años de edad vive con su cónyuge y su hijo de 9 años, en la ciudad de Cartagena de Indias, lugar que ha desarrollado su zona urbana, conservando el centro histórico y convirtiéndose en uno de los puertos de mayor importancia en Colombia, el Caribe y el mundo, así como un célebre destino turístico. Allí en un ambiente soleado, de playa, brisa y mar, Eliana se dedica a la actividad comercial, experiencia que inició desde hace 6 años, trabajando como empleada en un almacén de ropas y solo desde hace 1 año  empezó su propio negocio de comercio de ropa, en las líneas femeninas, masculino e infantil. Ella ha crecido poco a poco estructurando una clientela fija, que hoy le pagan de contado y potencializan su oferta. Cada día su clientela crece y tiene grandes desafíos como el de ofrecer mejores precios que la competencia, para sostenerse en el mercado, pero su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para hacer compras en mayor volumen, que le permitan obtener descuentos especiales, para trasladarlos a los precios de venta y sostener a su clientela fiel. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, con el cual comprará mercancía variada como vestidos femeninos, ropa infantil y pantalones para caballeros. Con esta inversión aumentará su potencial de ventas y generará un aumento en su capital de trabajo y esto es justamente lo que Eliana necesita y es el éxito de esta inversión de Kiva.
texts.en:
Eliana is 31 years old and lives with her partner and their 9 year old son in the city of Cartagena de Indias.  The city has developed its urban area, conserved its historic district, and become one of the most important ports in Colombia, the Caribbean, and the world, as well as becoming a celebrated tourist destination.  

There in the sunny atmosphere of beaches, breeze, and sea, Eliana works as a merchant.  About six years ago, she began working as an employee at a clothing store and a year ago, she opened her own clothing store selling women's, men's, and children's clothing.  She has slowly grown the business, building a loyal customer base who pay in cash and improve her offerings.  Every day her customers increase and she has many challenges such as offering better prices than her competition to stay in the market, but her working capital is not sufficient to make purchases in large volumes, which would allow her to get special discounts which would translate to sale prices and sustain loyal customers.  

This has led her to request a Kiva loan to purchase merchandise such as women's dresses, children's clothing, and men's pants.  With this investment, she will increase her potential for sales and generate an increase in her working capital, which is what Eliana needs most and would be a success of this Kiva loan.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as women's dresses, children's clothing, and men's pants.

loans.name: Mohamed M

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Mohamed.  He is married, with three children, ages 22, 19 and 15 years, all in school. 

In 1998, Mohamed established his pharmacy business. He began his business for self employment, and it is his only source of survival.  Working 7 days a week and 13 hours a day, he earns about Le 720,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan of Le 5,000,000. Mohamed has already received and successfully repaid two loans.  He now requires a new loan in order to buy more medicines to stock. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 340,000. 

In the future, Mohamed still musters the plan of building a back house, modernizing his drug store, and educating his children.   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more medicines for his pharmacy

loans.name: Ifenibidoun Group

texts.fr: IFENIBIDOUN est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies et vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Anielle (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 55  ans et est mariée à un certain Samuel. Le couple a deux enfants, dont un est scolarisé et tous à leur charge. Anielle et son mari assurent ensemble les différentes charges des enfants. Anielle a arrêté l’école au cours primaire.  Il y a une trentaine d’année que Anielle vend du charbon de bois et des cartes de recharges téléphoniques de façon secondaire à son domicile. Anielle exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Anielle s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’augmenter son fonds de roulement, Anielle sollicite un crédit avec les autres membres du groupe IFENIBIDOUN. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
IFENIBIDOUN is a group made up of three members who are friends and live in the same neighborhood.

The group's representative, named Anielle and raising her hand in the photo, is 55 years old and married to a man named Samuel.

Anielle and Samuel have two children, one of whom attends school.  Both children are their dependents.  Anielle and her husband jointly take care of the various expenses associated with raising their children.  

Anielle left school in first grade.

Anielle has been selling charcoal - and additionally telephone recharge cards - from her home for about thirty years.  She has a passion for her work, which allows her to meet her needs as well as those of her children.  She buys her supplies from a town in Benin.

In order to satisfy her clients' needs and to increase her working capital, she is requesting a loan, along with the other members of the IFENIBIDOUN group.  

This loan will allow them to better meet their customers' demand, and to increase their profits.

loans.use: to buy charcoal.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de compra y venta de verduras como lechugas,zanahorias y tomates y luego los envia a lugares como Puerto Maldonado,la socia tambien se dedica al negocio de crianza de animales como gallinas y cuyes,la socia los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cuyes y gallinas.La socia solicita el credito para comprar gallinas y cuyes y tambien para comprar verduras como lechugas,zanahorias y tomates.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member makes a living from the commerce of vegetables like lettuce, carrots and tomatoes, which sends to places like Puerto Maldonado. She also makes a living raising small animals like chickens and guinea pigs. 

The member makes them gain weight and grow and then sells them in the different fairs, the dream of the partner is to have a small store where she can sell the guinea pigs and chickens.

The member asks for the loan to buy chickens and guinea pigs, and also to buy vegetables such as lettuce, carrots and tomatoes. The member is happy to receive the loan and commits to making her payments

loans.use: to buy chickens and guinea pigs, and also to buy vegetables such as lettuce, carrots and tomatoes

loans.name: Dianne Diony

texts.es:
La socia Dioni,  tiene 28 años de edad y  tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 2 hijos, la socia sigue con el negocio de compra y venta de cámaras digitales, ella sigue viajando al país de  Bolivia para comprar mercadería y así poder abastecer y luego distribuye a sus clientes en la ciudad del Cusco. 
La socia Dioni solicita el préstamo para comprar más mercadería  o sea cámaras digitales  para así poder ofrecer a más clientes y de esta manera tener más ganancia. La socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. 

La socia pertenece al banco comunal” COMUZONE III” y está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Dianne, 28, is in a common-law marriage and has two children. She is still in the business of buying and selling digital cameras. She continues traveling to the country of Bolivia to buy merchandise and that way be able to supply and later distribute to her customers in the city of Cusco. Dianne is applying for the loan to buy more merchadise —digital cameras— to be able to serve more customers and that may earn more income. She is a happy person with a lot of desire to move forward. She belongs to the communal bank COMUZONE III and is happy for the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise - digital cameras.

loans.name: Mahouton Group

texts.fr: MAHOUTON est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amis et résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Lisette (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 37 ans et est mariée à un certain Etienne. Le couple a deux enfants, dont un est scolarisé et tous à leur charge. Lisette et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges des enfants. Lisette n’a pas fréquenté l’école.  Il y a près de quinze ans que Lisette mène comme activité la vente de produits de mercerie et divers articles à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Lisette vend de la nourriture. Lisette exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Lisette s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Lisette sollicite un deuxième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe MAHOUTON. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Le premier crédit a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
MAHOUTON is a group made up of three members who are friends and live in the same neighborhood in Benin.

The group's representative, Lisette, is raising her hand in the photo.  She is 37 years old and married to a man named Etienne.

Lisette and Etienne have two children, one of whom attends school.  Both children are their dependents. 

Lisette and her husband live with their children and jointly take care of the various expenses associated with raising their children.  

Lisette never attended school.  For the past fifteen years or so she has been selling sewing supplies and various other items from her home.  Additionally, she also sells food products.

She has a passion for her work, which allows her to meet her needs as well as those of her children.  She buys her supplies from a market in Benin.

In order to satisfy her customers' needs she is requesting a second loan, along with the other members of the MAHOUTON group.

This loan will allow them to better meet their customers'  needs and to make more profits.  Their first loan was duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies and other various items.

loans.name: Victor Rodrigo

texts.es:
VICTOR ES CASADO TIENE 67 AÑOS VIVE CON LA ESPOSA TIENE TRES HIJOS TODOS MAYORES DE EDAD Y CASADOS. VIVE EN CHIMBO

VICTOR TRABAJA COMO PROFESOR EN LA UNIVERSIDAD DE BOLIVAR COMO DOCENTE, EL DINERO LO SOLICITA PARA EL PAGO DE DEUDAS. EL CREDITO LE AYUDADO A NO QUEDAR MAL CON LAS PERSONAS QUE HAN CONFIADO EN EL PARA DAR LAS COSAS A CREDITO.

VICTOR EN LOS TIENPOS LIBRES SE DEDICA A CAMINAR Y REUNIRSE CON LOS NIETOS.
texts.en:
Victor is 67, and married. He lives with his wife, and has three children, all adults and married. He lives in Chimbo. 

Victor works as a professor at Bolivar University. The money he is requesting is to pay debts. The loan has helped him not be on bad terms with people who have trusted him enough to sell him things on credit.

In his free time, Victor walks and gets together with his grandchildren.

loans.use: To pay debts.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Abdul. He is married and has four children aged 21, 17, 15 and 11; all are schooling. 

In 2001, Abdul established his drinks business. He began his business because he wanted to generate enough funds to support his children's education; it is his only source of income. Working seven days a week and 14 hours a day, he earns about Le 700,000 (Sierra Leone leones) every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000. Abdul has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy Star beer, stout, Vicco malt, cane soft and bottle soft (all are different types of drinks). 

He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 320,000. In the future, Abdul plans to become a distributor for a brewery, to educate his children and to develop his other plot of land. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy drinks.

loans.name: Emmaculate

texts.en:
Emmaculate lives in the Kongowea area of Coast province, Kenya. She has eight children; seven attend school. She owns a tailoring shop, a business she has been operating for 15 years.

She learned about Milango through a friend who invited her to the group, and she joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve the business operations. The challenge she is facing is bad debts from customers due to late payments.

Emmaculate is applying for a loan of 53,750 Kenya shillings to purchase threads, sewing needles and materials. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to pay school fees for her children. Her plan for the future is to open a boutique in the area.

loans.use: To purchase threads, sewing needles and materials.

loans.name: Wangninangbe Group

texts.fr: Le groupe WANGNINANGBE est formé de trois personnes qui sont des amies. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Inès Mahougnon est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Inès Mahougnon ne vit plus avec son mari, mais a un enfant qui est scolarisé et qui vit à sa charge. Inès Mahougnon vit seule avec son enfant. Inès Mahougnon supporte seule ses diverses charges et ceux de son enfant. Inès Mahougnon n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Il y a huit ans environs que Inès Mahougnon mène comme activité la vente des cartes de recharges à son domicile. Inès Mahougnon s’approvisionne au Togo. La demande de sa clientèle devient de plus en plus grande et compte tenu de ses moyens limités, Inès Mahougnon n'arrive plus à bien répondre à leurs exigences. Eu égard à cela et compte tenu de leurs ressources limitées, Inès Mahougnon et les autres membres du groupe WANGNINANGBE sollicitent ensemble un  troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux prêts antérieurement reçus ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
WANGNINANGBE is a group made up of three members who are friends. The group's representative, Inès Mahougnon, is the one raising her hand in the photo.

It is the third time that this group is requesting financial assistance from ALIDé in order to raise the level of its activity.

Inès Mahougnon no longer lives with her husband, but she has one child who attends school and is her dependent.  As she lives alone with her child, she takes care of her needs and those associated with raising her child, alone.

Inès Mahougnon never attended school.  For the past eight years or so, she has been selling recharge cards from her home.  She buys her goods in Togo.

Facing an increasing demand from her customers, and given the fact that her resources are limited, she can no longer meet all of her customers' needs.

Because of this and in spite of their limited means, Inès Mahougnon and the other members of the WANGNINANGBE group are jointly requesting a third loan from ALIDé.  Their two previous loans have been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy telephone recharge cards.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es: Efrain, tiene 48 años de edad, está casado, tiene 5 hijos y vive en el municipio de Morazan, Yoro. Efrain se ha dedicado a la agricultura pero hace 4 años decidió tener su propio negocio para obtener los ingresos necesarios para sostener a su familia. el realiza dos actividades una es que compra frutas y verduras y las vende de manera ambulante en su vehículo, y la otra es que estableció una pulpería para vender productos de la canasta básica como azúcar, arroz, pan, frijoles, maíz, café, abarrotes, lácteos, etc.la pulpería la atiende su esposa e hijos. Ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 15,000 Lempiras para comprar frutas de temporada y verduras para vender y otra parte para surtir el negocio de pulpería de productos alimenticios. Espera que esta inversión le ayude a incrementar las ventas y mantener siempre capital de trabajo. Su meta es mejorar su  calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Efrain is 48 years old. He is married, has five children, and lives in the town of Morazan, Yoro department. Efrain has been a farmer, but four years ago, decided to have his own business, in order to earn the income necessary to support his family. 

He has two businesses: one is that he buys fruit and vegetables and sells them as a travelling vendor in his truck, and the other is that he set up a small general store to sell basic household products, such as sugar, rice, bread, beans, corn, coffee, groceries, dairy products, etc. His wife and children run the store. 

He has decided to request a loan of 15,000 lempiras, in order to buy seasonal fruit and vegetables to sell, and use another part to stock his store business with food products. 

He hopes that this investment helps him increase sales and to always have working capital set aside. His goal is to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables and stock his small general store with food products.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael lives in the Changamwe area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has four school-going children. He owns a grocery shop, a business that he has been operating for 10 years. He started the business through his personal savings. Besides this, Michael also sells charcoal and carries out masonry work.

He learned about Milango through friends who invited him to the group, and he joined the group with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are high transport and fuel costs and seasonal weather.

Michael is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to buy additional stock of grocery items, e.g. bags of potatoes, cabbages, carrots, onions, etc. He will use the extra income from the loan to pay for his children’s school fees. His future plan is to become the wholesaler/supplier of the area.

loans.use: To buy stock of grocery items, e.g. potatoes, cabbages, carrots, onions, etc.

loans.name: Sebognan Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SEBOGNAN est composé de trois personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier au Bénin. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Ganyatou est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Ganyatou est âgée de 31 ans et est mariée à un comptable du nom de Vincent. Le couple a deux enfants, dont un scolarisé, et tous à leur charge. Ganyatou n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Ganyatou vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les divers besoins du ménage. Pour assurer ses différentes charges, Ganyatou mène comme activité la vente des bijoux par le système de distribution et de façon ambulante. Ganyatou s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Ganyatou sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe SEBOGNAN, un deuxime crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt leur servira à rehausser le stock de ses produits et à augmenter leur clientèle. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: The Sebognan group is composed of three individuals living in the same neighborhood in Benin. This is the second time that the group is seeking financial support from ALIDé, in order to expand their business. The group’s representative, by the name of Ganyatou, is the one raising her hand in the photo. Ganyatou is 31 years old and married to Vincent, an accountant. They have two dependent children, one of whom is in school. Ganyatou did not attend school. Ganyatou lives together with her husband and children. The spouses jointly provide for various household needs. In order to meet her  expenses, Ganyatou sells jewelry, through a distribution system and also as a street vendor. Ganyatou stocks up at one of the markets in Benin. With the goal of meeting customer demand and increasing her sales volume and revenues, Ganyatou, together with the other members of the Sebognan group, is seeking her second loan from ALIDé. This loan will allow group members to stock up on their goods and increase their customer base. The prior loan has been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy jewelry.

loans.name: Foday

texts.en:
This is 54-year-old Foday.  He is married, with four children, ages 27, 24, 20, and 17. 

In 2006, Foday established his empty five-gallon rubber containers and roofing nails business. He began his business because he wanted to raise adequate funds to fulfill his domestic commitment, and it is his only source of income. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about Le 530,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan of Le 4,000,000.  Foday requires a loan in order to buy empty five-gallon containers and roofing nails. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 260,000. 

In the future, Foday plans to build a house and to support the education of his kids.   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy empty five-gallon rubber containers and roofing nails

loans.name: Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité "Unidas" cuenta con 12 integrantes, quienes fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas.
La sra. Mirtha se dedica a la venta de lencerías, le gustaría tener un puesto propio donde ofrecer sus mercaderías es por eso que se esfuerza bastante diariamente por lograr su sueño y así también por mantener a su familia por medio de este trabajo y su dedicación al mismo.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de camisolines, corpiños, biquinis, etc. que los va a vender a su clientela, pero ya esta vez con mayor variedad que ofrecer.
texts.en:
The "Unidas" communal bank has 12 members, who have set as their main objective the growth of each one of them. 

Mirtha sells lingerie. She would like to have her own stand for selling merchandise. That is why she she works quite hard every day to achieve her dream, and also to support her family by means of this work and her dedication to it.  

She is requesting the loan to buy nightgowns, bras, bikinis, etc. to sell to her clientele, but this time with greater variety to offer.

loans.use: To buy underwear, bikinis, bras, etc.

loans.name: Ramadhani

texts.en:
Ramadhani, who lives in Mombasa, Kenya, is a water vendor. He is married and has eight children. He supplies water to his neighborhoods; this idea came from the fact that there is a challenge of water delivery in the area. Besides this, he also wants to own a motorcycle that he will use to ferry people around the area. 

A loan of 83,450 will help Ramadhani to buy a motorbike. Apart from the high cost of living all over that has reduced the disposable income of many customers to such businesses, Ramadhani intends to purchase more motorcycles in the future.

He believes the income from the business will help educate his children.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional stock of clothing.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es: El señor Orlando tiene 28 años de edad casado mas de 9 años ambos con una instrucción de nivel secundario (bachilleres), con 2 hijos dependientes, viven en el pueblo de Colomi zona sud avenida Gualberto Villarroel en la casa de sus padres. El señor Orlando y su esposa son personas muy emprendedores y trabajadores se dedican a la sastrería (costuran pantalones, pantaletas, ternos, arreglos y otros) con una actividad regular durante el año, lo cual ellos necesitan dinero para comprar tela-materia prima para costura para ellos es urgente porque tiene pedidos para costurar pantalones y otros, además con el ahorro que tenían compraron una maquina industrial de costura. Por ultimo nos cuentan se sienten muy felices al haber conseguido lo que más estaban necesitando ahora harán  con toda tranquilidad los trabajos que ya tenía pedidos aparte de seguir mejorando su actividad económica hacia el futuro con un sueño hasta comprar una casa propia para su familia para vivir más cómodos ya que actualmente están viviendo en la casa de sus padres.
texts.en: Orlando is 28 years old, and has been married for more than nine years. Both spouses have education through secondary school, with two dependent children. They live in the village of Colomi, the south zone, on Gualberto Villarroel Avenue in his parents house. Orlando and his wife are very enterprising and hardworking. They work tailoring regularly during the year. They sew pants, underwear, suits, repairs, and other things. They need money to buy fabric and raw materials for sewing. For them it is urgent because they have orders to sew pants and other garments. With the savings that they had, they bought an industrial sewing machine. They told us that they feel very happy for getting what they needed the most. Now they can calmly do their work since they had orders. Apart from improving their economic activity, in the future they have the dream of buying their own house for the family to love more comfortably. Currently they live in his parents' house.

loans.use: to buy raw materials (fabric).

loans.name: Rosseld

texts.es:
El socio Rosseld tiene 20 años  de edad y es soltero,el socio trabaja en un taller de mecanica,el arregla carros y motos,el socio trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,el socio se dedica a este trabajo 5 años,el socio por medio de este trabajo quiere salir adelante,el sueño del socio es tener su propio taller de mecanica.El socio solicita el credito para comprar herramientas de trabajo como martillos,alicates y pegamentos.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Rosseld, 20, is single and works as a mechanic fixing cars and motorcycles. He works from 7am to 6pm. He has been in the business for 5 years, and wants to use this work to get ahead. His dream is to have his own mechanics shop. He asks for a loan to buy tools of the trade like a hammer, clippers and adhesives.

He is happy about the loan and promises to make his payments.

loans.use: to buy tools like hammers, clippers and adhesives.

loans.name: Gorret

texts.en:
Gorret lives in the Likoni area of Coast Province in Kenya. She is single and has one child. She owns a farming business, which she has been operating for five years. She started the business through her own savings. She also owns a poultry farm.
She learned about Milango through a friend who invited her to the group, and she joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve the business operations. The challenges that she faces include purchasing stock, seasonal weather, and high transport and fuel costs.
Gorret is applying for a loan of 21,100 KES to renovate the poultry house and to buy manure for the farm. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings for her personal needs. Her plan for the future is to expand and to buy a lorry for transporting the farm’s products.

loans.use: to renovate the poultry house and to buy manure for the farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy water pipes for his water business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more fuel wood and charcoal.

loans.name: Ndinda

texts.en: Ndinda's poultry-rearing business received a great boost from the loan that she received. Ndinda is therefore asking for an additional loan of 85,850 Kenya shillings to increase her number of birds, and also to purchase poultry feed.

loans.use: to purchase more broilers and poultry feed

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is married with 4 children. She is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines.
Helen is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 1 year. She has requested a loan of 17000 to purchase feed, vitamins and baby pigs.
Helen has been a member of PMPC for 8 years. In the future, Helen hopes to have savings to use for expansion on her business.

loans.use: To purchase feed, vitamins and baby pigs

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru: Фируза студентка института экономики. Она родилась 23 – го февраля 1993 года. Фируза живет с родителями, в семье их шесть человек. Отец  Садулло 1956 года рождения, работает в Агентстве борьбе с наркотиками, мать домохозяйка. После окончания школы  Фируза поступила в институт экономики, в экономический факультет на договорной основе.  В настоящее время Фируза оканчивает второй курс и перешла на третий. В институте Фируза не отстает от своих однокурсников, учится на четверки и пятерки, среди сокурсников ее очень уважают и дорожат ее дружбой. Фируза принимает  активное  участие в студенческих мероприятиях и жизни института. В свободное время Фируза по дому помогает маме, читает художественную литературу, а также занимается шитьем национальной одежды. Фируза запрашивает с нашей организации  кредит в размере 925 USD. Она собирается оплатить годовой договор университета за учебу. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Firuza is a student at the College of Economics. She was born on February 23, 1993. Firuza lives with her parents; there are six people in their family. Her father, Sadullo, was born in 1956. He works  for the Anti-Drug Agency. Firuza’s mother is a homemaker. After finishing secondary school, Firuza was admitted to the College of Economics, the Department of Economics, as a self-paying student. At present Firuza finished her second year of studies and is about to start her third year. Firuza keeps up with her fellow students, receiving high grades. Her fellow students respect her and value her friendship. Firuza takes an active part in institutional events and student life. In her free time, Firuza helps her mother with household tasks, reads fiction and also sews traditional national clothing. Firuza is requesting from our organization a loan in the amount of 925 USD. She intends to pay her annual tuition. She hopes for your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her college tuition.

loans.name: Judit

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “UNIDOS PARA ELTRIUNFO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Judit; La socia continua con su negocio de brindar servicio tecnico para todo tipo de electrodomesticos,la socia trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo en este negocio,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia su negocio ,la socia cuenta con un local donde repara todos estos elctrodomesticos el cual se encuentra ubicado por el centro de la ciudad,la socia trabaja de luenes a sabado en este su negocio, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de repuestos para su negocio.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Judit belongs to the village bank "Unidos para el Triunfo" located in the district, province and state of Cusco. She continues providing technical services for all types of electronics. She works together with her spouse and has been doing this for some years. It's going well thanks to the determination she puts into her business every day. She has a store in the city center where she repairs appliances. She works from Monday to Saturday, because this business is how she gets her family ahead.

She asks for a loan to buy repair parts for her business. She is grateful to those who are a part of her dream in this way and she promises to make her payments in the established time period.

loans.use: to buy electronics repair parts for her business.

loans.name: Cesar Humberto

texts.es:
CESAR ES CASADO TIENE DOS HIJOS VIVE TIENE 42 AÑOS EN CHIMBO JUNTO A SU FAMILIA EN LA CIUDAD DE CHIMBO.

CESAR SE DEDICA A LA CONSTRUCCION DE VIVIENDAS, EL DINERO SOLICITA PARA LA COMPRAR DE BIENES PARA  AMOBLAR LA CASA PARA QUE LA ESPOSA Y LOS HIJOS VIVAN MAS COMODOS. EL DIENRO DEL CREDITO LE AYUDADO PARA ADQUIRIR LAS COSAS EN EFECTIVO Y NO COMPRAR A CREDITO.

CESAR EN LOS TIEMPOS LIBRES LE GUSTA SALIR CON LA FAMILIA A CAMINAR.
texts.en:
Cesar, 42, is married and has two children. He and his family live in the city of Chimbo. Cesar works in home construction. He requests money to furnish his house so that his wife and children will live more comfortably. The money from the loan will help him to buy things in cash instead of on credit.

In his free time, Cesar likes to go on walks with his family.

loans.use: to buy goods to furnish the house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase chairs and books.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 28 years old and lives in Naga, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is single with 1 child. 
Marivic has a general store that sells consumable products. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan of 5000 to purchase more stocks for her general store such as sugar, Colgate toothpaste, salt, vinegar, and other consumable products.
Marivic just became a member of PMPC this year. In the future, Marivic hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks for her general store such as sugar, Colgate toothpaste, salt, vinegar, and other consumable products

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en: Arlene is from Sumirap, Tangub City. She is 42 years old. Arlene is married and has 2 children. To make a living, she manages a business buying and selling shrimp and crabs. She has been in her business for 2 years and earns 10,000 a month from these activities. In 2011, Arlene joined GDMPC. Arlene is requesting a loan of 15,000 which will be used to buy additional shrimp and crabs to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional shrimp and crabs to sell.

loans.name: Chalene

texts.en:
Chalene is 32 years old and lives in Punta, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 1 child. 
To earn a living, Chalene has a business selling tempura, butchi, fish balls and palamig (a beverage). She earns about PHP 6,000.00 each month doing this type of work. Chalene has requested a loan of 20000 to be used in purchasing tempura, butchi, and fish balls.
Chalene has just joined PMPC this year. In the future, Chalene would like to expand her business.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing tempura, butchi, fish balls and ingredients for making palamig (a beverage)

loans.name: Abumuslimi

texts.ru: Абумуслим житель города Дангара. Ему 22 года. Он женат. Абумуслим занимается скотоводством. Он более двух лет занимается этим видом деятельности. Абумуслим берет кредит для закупа скот с целью увеличения их количества.
texts.en: Abumuslim lives in the town of Dangar. He is 22 years old and married. Abumuslim raises livestock. He has been in this business for over two years. He is taking out a loan in order to buy more farm animals  so as  to expand their headcount.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy boxes of chicken, sausages, soya, tomato sauce and foam plates

loans.name: Marife Group

texts.en: Marife is 34 years old and lives in Pantaon Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. Marife has a general store that sells consumable products. She has had this business for 1 year and 6 months. She requested a loan of 6000 to purchase canned goods, cartons of mosquito repellent, candies, beverages etc. Marife has been a member of PMPC for 18 months. In the future, Marife hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase canned goods, cartons of mosquito repellent, candies, beverages etc.

loans.name: Ireneo

texts.en:
Ireneo is widowed with 3 children. He is 57 years old and lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.

Ireneo sells fish, meat and chicken to earn a living and has had this business for 30 years. He has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to be used in purchasing more fish, and also in purchasing chicken and meat for his sideline business.

Ireneo has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, he hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish, and also to purchase chicken and meat for his sideline business.

loans.name: Geny

texts.en: Geny is a 28-year-old resident of Pangabuan in Tangub City. She provides for her three children’s needs from the little amount of 5,000 PHP that she gains monthly from her own piggery business, which she has had for 5 years. This is in addition to the income gained from her husband. However, in 2011 she became a member of GDMPC, and she is applying for a loan of 10,000 PHP at GDMPC to buy feeding supplies. Geny wants to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is from Pangabuan, Tangub City. She is 46 years old and married, with four children. 

Fe raises pigs for a living.  She has done this work for seven years and earns PHP 6,000 a month. In 2010, Fe joined GDMPC. 

Fe is requesting a loan of PHP 8,300, which will be used to buy feed. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en: Leonila is single and 56-years-old. She resides in Garang in Tangub City. Leonila plants, harvests, and sells rice as well as vegetables to earn a living, and she's been in this business for 20 years. Each month, she earns 10,000 PHP doing this type of work. She requested a loan of 10,500 PHP to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. In 2009, Leonila joined GDMPC. In the future, Leonila wants to improve her house and the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is married with 2 children. She is 41 years old and lives in Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena.

Jean has a general store to earn a living and has had this business for 7 years. Each month, she earns 7,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase assorted goods like sugar, cooking oil, sachets of shampoo, milk and coffee.

Jean has been a member of PMPC for 7 years. In the future, she hopes to finish her house.

loans.use: to pay for assorted goods like sugar, cooking oil, sachets of shampoo, milk and coffee.

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occiden

loans.name: 040302- Liên Minh- Hoằng Trường-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Chúc operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish for resale.

Chúc is 50 years old and she is married with three grown children.
She is the leader of a four-member group, the 040302- Liên Minh- Hoằng Trường-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. 
Chúc has operated her business for more than 10 years in Hoang Hoa District, a rural town in Thanh Hoa Province.

In 2002, Chúc joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Chúc has successfully repaid five loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Chúc faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Chúc hopes to make enough money to maintain a successful business and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment.

loans.use: to purchase fish for resale.

loans.name: Chynygul

texts.ru:
Чыныгул 55 лет, замужем, воспитала 2 детей, младший сын 16 лет помогает ей во всем. Чыныгул работает учителем в местной школе и в качестве дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, на протяжении 30 лет занимается полеводством  и животноводством, начав этот бизнес с 1,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Чыныгул в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется 5 коров с приплодом, 55 голов мелкого рогатого скота, 2 лошади, ежемесячная прибыль от хозяйства составляет около 4,000 сом (KGS). Также, Чыныгул обрабатывает 4 га земли с многолетними травами, служащей в качестве корма для скота. 
Так как осенний период является особенно активным, что связано с сезонностью в агросекторе, Чыныгул также, как и многие жители сел, нуждается в финансовой поддержке для развития своего бизнеса. В связи с этим, Чыныгул обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дойных коров.  На часть доходов от кредита Чыныгул хотела бы приобрести ноутбук для сына для подготовки к поступлению в университет, а в дальнейшем - планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса.
texts.en:
Chynygul is 55 years old and married. She has brought up two children. Her youngest son, 16 years old, helps her in everything. Chynygul works as a teacher at the local school. As an additional source of income for her family, for some 30 years she has also been doing farm work and raising livestock, having launched this business with 1,000 KGS. Thanks to Chynygul’s hard work, her farm now includes five cows with calves, 55 heads of small cattle, and two horses. Her monthly revenues from her farm are about 4,000 KGS. In addition, Chynygul works four ha [about 9.4 acres] of land, growing perennials that are used as animal feed.

Since the fall season is particularly busy due to seasonal agricultural work, Chynygul,  like many village dwellers, is in need of financial support to develop her business. This is why she turned to “Bai Tushum & Partners” for a loan in the amount of 70,000 KGS to buy dairy cows. Chynygul would like to use part of her resulting revenues to buy a notebook for her son, who is preparing to apply for college; in the future she plans to keep reinvesting in her business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Yby Pyta 1 Group

texts.es:
El comité "Yby Pyta 1" tiene 13 integrantes, se encuentra en su cuarto ciclo, demuestran ser un grupo solidario y con un espíritu emprendedor.
Delia, una de las integrantes del grupo, que también se dedica a la cría de animales como todas las demás, es una persona trabajadora, emprendedora y solidaria que busca salir adelante, crecer su negocio, tener más cantidades de animales que criar, engordar y venderlos y de esta manera generar más ingresos para ella y su familia.
Solicita el crédito para comprar animales y balanceados para alimentarlos.
texts.en:
The committee "Yby Pyta 1" has 13 members and is in its fourth lending cycle. They have shown themselves to be a united group with an entrepreneurial spirit.

Delia, one of the members of the group, works in animal husbandry like all the others. She is hardworking, entrepreneurial and united. She wants to get ahead, grow her business, and have more animals to raise, fatten and sell. This will generate more income for her family.

She asks for a loan to buy animals and balanced feed.

loans.use: to buy animals and balanced feed.

loans.name: 040301- Liên Minh- Hoằng Trường-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Tiến operates a fishing business fishing and is requesting a loan to purchase netting to fish. Tiến has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Tiến is 40 years old and is married with three children.
She is the leader of a six-member group, the 040301- Liên Minh- Hoằng Trường-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. 
Tiến supports two dependents with her business in Hoang Hoa District, a rural town in Thanh Hoa Province. Another child is grown up.
